Headline: Canada Afternoon: C$ Ends Flat As Market Awaits BOC Rate Call
Story: TORONTO (Dow Jones)--The Canadian dollar ended little-changed after a session of near-static range trading Monday, as public holidays overseas and the approach of Tuesday's Bank of Canada interest rate announcement kept activity to a minimum.   The U.S. dollar was trading at C$1.0802at 3:22 p.m. EDT (1922 GMT), from C$1.0812 at 8:00 a.m. EDT (1200 GMT), and from C$1.0792 late Friday.   Faced with no domestic economic data and the approach of the central bank's rate announcement Tuesday, the Canadian dollar shared in the overall global tendency toward only limited currency market activity forced by public holidays in the U.S., the U.K., and Switzerland Monday.   The Canadian unit spent the day mired in an extremely tight C$1.0790 to C$1.0811 range, as the few active local currency players hunkered down to await the Bank of Canada rate decision at 9:00 a.m. EDT (1300 GMT) Tuesday.   While no one expects the Bank to make any change to its benchmark overnight interest rate target - which has sat at its present 4.25% setting since last May - there is less unanimity regarding the general tone the Bank will take in its accompanying statement.   Many Canadian economic releases recently have come in on the high side of forecasts, and the better-than-expected performance of the domestic economy has led many to predict an impending shift toward a more hawkish policy bias at the central bank.   This change in outlook among many market participants has noticeably bolstered the Canadian dollar on its recent tear to new three-decade highs, and could form the basis of a renewed wave of appreciation should the central bank release a hawkish-sounding statement Tuesday.   However, others have cautioned that the Canadian currency has become over-extended and could be vulnerable to a setback if the Bank of Canada continues to be circumspect about its policy leanings.   John Johnston, chief strategist at the Harbour Group of RBC Dominion Securities in Toronto, said in a commentary that the "case for a pullback remains compelling" for the Canadian dollar, in part because currency markets may have overstated the likelihood of a more hawkish Bank of Canada.   Johnston argues that with the U.S. economy still struggling and the latest wave of Canadian dollar appreciation posing problems for local manufacturers and other firms, a strong case can be made for the Bank of Canada to resist turning to more restrictive monetary policy settings.   "Sentiment in the marketplace is turning toward possible rate hikes in July and September, and it appears that markets are anticipating a more hawkish tone in tomorrow's statement," Johston said. "Our sense is that the most likely outcome tomorrow is that the statement is the same as last time, with the inflation risk assessment still only a 'slight tilt to the upside.'"   These are the exchange rates at 3:22 p.m. EDT (1922 GMT), 8:00 a.m. EDT (1200 GMT), and late Friday.     USD/CAD     1.0802     1.0812     1.0792     EUR/CAD     1.4535     1.4551     1.4516     CAD/JPY     112.71     112.59     112.85   -By Paul Evans; Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2022; paulr.evans@dowjones.com       (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 15:24 ET (19:24 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : TVI Pacific Announces Webcast Details For Annual Meeting>TVI.T
Story: CALGARY, ALBERTA--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - TVI Pacific Inc. (TSX:TVI) ("TVI" or the "Company") announces that it will be webcasting the corporate and social commitments presentation portion of TVI's Annual and Special Meeting of Shareholders which will be made by Clifford M. James, President and CEO of the Company, as well as other senior officers. This presentation will provide an expanded commentary on the Company's operations, exploration, drilling, social commitment and environmental endeavors. TVI's Annual and Special Meeting will be held on May 31st, 2007, at the Calgary Petroleum Club (319-5th Ave. SW), with the formal part of the meeting starting at 3:00 pm MT.    Webcast:    The live webcast will start at approximately 3:10 pm MT on May 31, 2007. To listen to this event, please enter the following link into your web browser a few minutes prior to the start time. Information links will also be provided for any software needed and system requirements.    http://w.on24.com/r.htm?e=50689&s=1&k=B642281C60C76C0660D8C81A33C4E2DC    The link above will also allow listeners to view / download an electronic version of TVI's corporate presentation and watch an audio visual presentation as they are presented at the Annual & Special Meeting.    For those who are not able to listen to the live call on the day of the event, the webcast will be archived for 90 days and can be accessed using the same link above or by going to the Company's website at www.tvipacific.com.      About TVI Pacific Inc. (TSX: TVI)    TVI Pacific Inc. is a publicly traded Canadian mining company focused on exploring for and producing precious and base metals within district scale systems in Asia.    In the Philippines, TVI's most advanced project, the Canatuan Mine (the first foreign-invested, new, mining project in the Philippines since the passage of the Philippine Mining Act of 1995) began mining and milling operations in mid-2004, producing gold and silver dore through its affiliate TVI Resource Development (Phils.) Ltd. ("TVIRD"). In 2006, TVIRD received a completed NI 43-101 feasibility study on the Canatuan Sulphide project prepared by Norwest Corporation. The report has been filed with certain securities regulatory authorities in Canada and is available at the SEDAR website at www.sedar.com. The Norwest study addresses the copper-zinc bearing massive sulphide zone, or lower portion of the Canatuan Deposit. Construction of the Sulphide Project at Canatuan is now underway. In addition, TVIRD holds a 2.5% NSR on the Philippine-based Rapu Rapu project operated by Lafayette Mining Ltd. Exploration in the Philippines is being conducted at Canatuan, in an effort to expand TVIRD's mineral resource base and to find new deposits, at Balabag and at other areas which management of TVI view as compelling exploration properties.    In China, TVI's wholly-owned Chinese subsidiary, Hunan Pacific Geological Exploration Inc. ("HPGEI"), was the first foreign mining company to be granted both WOFE status and a Qualified Explorer License. The exploration program in China is focused primarily within the Golden Triangle area, a prospective metallogenic region in China's south-western provinces of Yunnan, Guizhou and Guangxi Autonomous Region and prospective areas in the Tibet Autonomous Region. HPGEI has 2,394 sq kms of land under application in China in the Golden Triangle and in the Tibet A.R.    TVI also has a Drilling Segment consisting of Exploration Drilling Corporation ("EDCO"), a wholly-owned subsidiary of TVI Pacific Inc. based in the Philippines, and Hunan Pacific Drilling ("HPD"), a segment of HPGEI based in China, which generates revenue from contract drilling.    The Toronto Stock Exchange has neither approved nor disapproved of the information contained herein.               FOR FURTHER INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT:             TVI Pacific Inc. Paul Moon           Director, Corporate Communications           (403) 265-4356           (403) 264-7028 (FAX)           Email: tvi-info@tvipacific.com           Website: www.tvipacific.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 17:28 ET (21:28 GMT)

Headline: : Cascade Microtech Announces the Tesla Power Semiconductor Device Characterization System
Story: BEAVERTON, Ore., May 28 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Cascade Microtech today announced its new Tesla power device characterization system. Tesla, unlike any other probing system, solves the on-wafer probing challenges for engineers and test technicians who need to characterize their power devices. The power semiconductor market is projected to grow from $25.8B in 2007 to $34.2B in 2009(1) fueled by the use of power devices in everything from industrial products to consumer electronics. The broad use of power semiconductors has created a pressing need to characterize devices quickly and efficiently. Design engineers and test technicians are under pressure to speed up the time-to-market for new power devices. To drive dramatic gains in productivity, Cascade Microtech designed Tesla, the industry's first power device measurement system providing a complete on-wafer solution for over- temperature, low contact resistance measurements of power semiconductors up to 60A and 3000V.        Until now -- power device characterization has been a major hassle     For years, power semiconductor device manufacturers have been forced to package their devices prior to characterization and model extraction. Wafer-level measurements on power devices have historically been fraught with unreliable or inaccurate data, extra costs, and uncertain delays in development schedules. Cascade Microtech's Tesla system finally solves this problem.     "The Tesla power device measurement system will reduce costs by eliminating the hassles of packaging devices before we characterize them," said Edouard de Fresart, power device section manager, SMARTMOS Technology Center, Freescale Semiconductor.  "It will have a huge effect on our productivity by reducing the wasted time and steps we incur in packaging while still providing accurate test data."     Power semiconductors in demand worldwide according to Yole Developpement PowerD-06 report     "Worldwide demand for power semiconductors is growing due to the double-digit demand for more efficient power utilization," said Philippe Roussel, project manager, Power Electronics, Yole Developpement, Lyon, France.     Power devices such as MOSFETs, (metal oxide semiconductor field-effect transistor) bipolar junction transistors (BJT), rectifiers, thyristors and insulated gate bipolar transistors (IGBT) are widely used in cell phone infrastructures, laptop computers, alternative energy vehicles, home appliances, electric trains and more. Power devices are characterized by their ability to accommodate higher current density, higher power dissipation and/or higher reverse breakdown voltage.        Technology innovations allow new on-wafer power device testing     Cascade Microtech's Tesla system features two new wafer probes, including a high current probe that reduces the potential for probe and device destruction during testing.  The probe can support an unprecedented 10A of current in continuous mode and up to 60A of current in pulsed mode. To reduce device heating, the probe tip is designed to minimize contact resistance at the wafer-to-probe interface.     The Tesla system also features a high voltage probe that ensures a high performance electrical measurement path at high voltages.  The high voltage probe provides the capability to make coaxial measurements up to 3000V and triaxial measurements up to 1100V.  In addition, both the high current and the high voltage probes feature a replaceable tip that is easily changed. The Tesla system's wafer chuck provides state-of-the-art handling for thin wafers.  An exclusive chuck top technology provides the right amount of vacuum in a delicate method that protects against wafer breakage and probe damage, all while ensuring a minimal contact resistance.     Other safety features of the Tesla system include the highly insulated and electrically shielded cable assemblies that provide both triaxial performance and high current/high voltage handling capabilities.  To ensure operator safety, ease of set-up and configuration, Tesla offers a safety interlock system and remote system operation.  The measurement environment and every component in the measurement path is designed and tested by Cascade Microtech to comply with voltages up to 3000V.        Price and availability for the complete Tesla system     Tesla is a turnkey, scaleable system. It is optimized for ease of purchase and configuration to create a safe testing environment for power semiconductor devices.  Tesla includes Cascade Microtech's industry-leading wafer probe station and probes and proprietary safety components. The Tesla system starts at U.S. $200,000. Pricing depends upon user options selected. Delivery is 12 weeks upon receipt of order. For more information, contact your Cascade Microtech sales representative at sales@cmicro.com.        About Cascade Microtech     Cascade Microtech, Inc. (Nasdaq: CSCD) is a worldwide leader in the precise electrical measurement and test of integrated circuits (ICs) and other small structures. For technology businesses and scientific institutions that need to evaluate small structures, Cascade Microtech delivers access to, and extraction of, electrical data from wafers, integrated circuits (ICs), IC packages, circuit boards and modules, MEMs, biological structures, electro- optic devices and more. Cascade Microtech's leading-edge semiconductor production test consumables include unique probe cards and test sockets that reduce manufacturing costs of high-speed and high-density semiconductor chips. Information about Cascade Microtech can be found on the Web at http://www.cascademicrotech.com.        (1) Source: Yole Developpement PowerD-06 report. Yole Developpement is the            world leader in the analysis of the microtechnologies and compound            semiconductors markets.    SOURCE  Cascade Microtech, Inc.       /CONTACT: Cali Sartor of Cascade Microtech, Inc., +1-503-601-1000, cali_sartor@cmicro.com; or Debra Seifert of McClenahan Bruer Communications, +1-503-546-1000, debra@mcbru.com, for Cascade Microtech, Inc.      /Web site: http://www.cascademicrotech.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 09:00 ET (13:00 GMT)

Headline: Hitachi:Keep FY09 Sales-Operating Profit Ratio Target Of 5%
Story: TOKYO (Dow Jones)--Hitachi Ltd. (6501.TO) said Monday it will continue to target a sales-to-operating profit ratio of 5% at a group level for the fiscal year ending March 2010 as it tries to establish a more profitable business structure.   The target, part of the electronics maker's revised  business plan, is unchanged from the initial plan unveiled last November.   Hitachi is also aiming to keep its debt-to-equity ratio below 0.8.     -By Kazuhiro Shimamura, Dow Jones Newswires; 813-5255-2929; kazuhiro.shimamura@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 02:29 ET (06:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Mitsui To Open 2 Steel Processing Bases In China -Nikkei
Story: TOKYO (Nikkei)--Mitsui & Co. (8031.TO) will by year-end set up two steel processing/distribution bases in China jointly with Baosteel Group Corp. at a combined cost of some Y2 billion, the Nikkei reported Monday.   One will be built in Shandong Province and supply steel sheet to auto makers, mainly Shanghai General Motors Co. It will have an annual processing capacity of 110,000 tons. The firm operating the base will be 65% owned by Baosteel.   The other will be built on an 80,000-sq.-meter site in Guangdong Province and have a processing capacity of 60,000 tons a year, turning out steel according to customer specifications. Delivery will be made to customers in southern China. It will also store products made by Baosteel and market them to users. Baosteel will hold a 75% stake in the firm running the facility.   Mitsui already operates 11 processing bases across China jointly with Baosteel.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 01:06 ET (05:06 GMT)

Headline: Ver.di Union Turns Down Deutsche Telekom Offer - Newspaper
Story: FRANKFURT (Dow Jones)--German services union ver.di has turned down a new offer from Deutsche Telekom AG (DT) for employees being transferred into a new services unit, Handelsblatt reports.   "It's nice that Telekom is considering a compromise, but what it has now offered is not one," ver.di negotiator Lother Schroeder told the newspaper.   The paper said Telekom added the possibility of performance-based bonuses in good times to its offer, but on the flip side Schroeder said employees shouldn't be saddled with company risk.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.handelsblatt.de     -Frankfurt Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 49-69-29725-500.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 09:11 ET (13:11 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Polish KGHM Eyes Copper Deposits In Germany -Newspaper
Story: WARSAW (Dow Jones)--Poland's copper producer KGHM Polska Miedz SA (KGH.WA) wants to apply for licenses to explore copper deposits in Germany, the daily Parkiet reports Monday.   The appropriate bid will be announced in three months, the paper said.   Monday or Tuesday KGHM will announce its investment strategy, according to the newspaper.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.kghm.com.pl.     -Warsaw Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; +4822 622-2766; +4822 622-2767     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 01:20 ET (05:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Seventh Continent Unveils Rostov Plans; Sees $55M Annual Rev
Story: MOSCOW (Dow Jones)--Russian grocery chain OAO Seventh Continent (SCON.RS) Monday said it would launch a joint retail development in the Rostov region that should provide it with an extra $55 million in annual revenue.   The company said in a statement it would build a 40,000- square-meter retail complex together with developer OOO Stroimontazh in the town of Novocherkassk.   Seventh Continent will take half of the project's total area, into which it will include one of its Nash brand hypermarkets.   The company, which posted 2006 revenue of around $1 billion, expects the complex to open in 2009.   Seventh Continent recently announced similar joint developments in Russia's Northwest Federal District.     Company Web site: http://www.7cont.ru     -By Andrew Langley, Dow Jones Newswires; +7 495 974 80 55; andrew.langley@dowjones.com     Corrected May 28, 2007 09:40 ET (13:40 GMT)  (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 09:38 ET (13:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Standard Chartered Sees Double-Digit Rise In Rev
Story: (Adds additional comments, and plans to expand in China and enter Indian securities brokerage business.)     By Amy Or   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     HONG KONG (Dow Jones)--Standard Chartered PLC (STAN.LN) said Monday it is confident of "good double-digit growth in revenue" this year, after recording a strong first-quarter performance.   While declining to give figures, Group Executive Director Kai Nargolwala said during a media briefing the bank's first-quarter results were "excellent" and that he is confident double-digit growth can be maintained in both consumer and wholesale banking.   The U.K.-based lender's revenue rose 26% last year to US$8.62 billion, while net profit rose 18% to US$2.25 billion.   Nargolwala said one area that Standard Chartered will invest heavily in is its consumer banking business, including the provision of services to wealthy individuals with up to US$50 million in assets.   Headquartered in Singapore, the bank's global private banking business will also shortly launch in 10 other cities, including Hong Kong, Beijing, London and Mumbai.   Nargolwala said the company plans to hire 200 bankers for the business in the next two years, with annual investment amounting to the "low tens of millions."   He said China is a major area of growth for the bank in the region, adding the lender plans to increase the number of its branches in the country to 40 this year from 22 now. It also plans to double the number of staff there to 4,000 this year.   He said Standard Chartered's strategy in China is still focused on organic growth.   "I don't think in China we have reached a roadblock where we can only grow our business through acquisitions," Nargolwala said.   He said the bank has no plans to take stakes in either institutional or retail securities brokerage firms in China at the moment.   Standard Chartered is, however, in talks to take a stake in India's UTI Securities Ltd. Nargolwala declined to say how much the stake would be, adding only that a purchase would be in line with the lender's strategy of developing its retail securities business.   A person close to the matter told Dow Jones Newswires earlier this month that Standard Chartered is in exclusive talks to buy 49% of UTI for INR1.35 billion (US$33.3 million).   Standard Chartered currently has no securities brokerage business in India, whose stock markets have been soaring.   Unlike HSBC Holdings PLC, which has repeatedly said it is aiming to list on China's yuan-denominated A-share market, Standard Chartered said it isn't seeking to list units on local bourses where they operate.   "We are happy with our listings in London and Hong Kong," Nargolwala said.     -By Amy Or, Dow Jones Newswires; 852-2832 2335; amy.or@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 06:55 ET (10:55 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE:Eni Says Police Seize Documents In Gas Measuring Probe
Story: (Updates 1053 GMT story with comment from Snam Rete Gas, Eni CEO)     ROME (Dow Jones)--Eni SpA (E), Italy's biggest oil and natural gas company by volumes, said Monday the fiscal police raided its offices and seized some documents in an investigation into its measuring instruments for the transport and distribution of gas in the country.   Eni said its companies involved in the probe were gas transmission company Snam Rete Gas SpA (SRG.MI) and distributor Italgas.   Eni Chief Executive Paolo Scaroni said a statement he was confident of the outcome. "In fact, as soon as I arrived at Eni I gave a mandate to specialized international consultants to undertake an assessment of these gas measurements procedures."   Eni said in an earlier statement other companies in the sector are involved in the investigation.   The Rome-based company said earlier CEO Scaroni was under investigation over the matter.   Eni said the probe centers on the venturi tube meters, which it added "have always been used in Italy and abroad," while the documents seized dated from 2003.   "There is the risk of a fine as well as the crucial element of reputation at stake should magistrates find that Eni did any wrongdoing," said a trader in Milan who asked not to be named.   Snam Rete Gas said in a statement it doesn't expect the probe to hit its results. Italy's biggest gas transmission company by pipelines expects the investigation will "confirm" it acted correctly.   Snam Rete Gas said its CEO Carlo Malacarne is one of those being investigated.   The company also said the technical reliability of the measuring instruments is constantly monitored by experts from leading research bodies.   Eni said the probe was part of an investigation started by Milan magistrates last year.   The company said these meters aren't used for calculating the gas utility bills of consumers.   The companies in the sector are being investigated for possible fraud, excise duty violations and the manipulation of measuring instruments, reported local newswire Ansa, without citing sources.   Under Italian law, magistrates are not allowed to publicly comment on ongoing investigations.   AEM SpA (AEM.MI), Italy's biggest municipal utility, also said Monday it is part of an investigation by Milan magistrates into the country's natural gas market, adding it is "confident" of the probe's outcome.   CEO Giuliano Zuccoli is being investigated, as well as some of the managers of AEM, said a spokesman.   AEM also said the probe doesn't involve retail utility bills.   At 1504 GMT, Eni shares fell EUR0.05, or 0.2%, at EUR26.25, while those of Snam Rete Gas were unchanged at EUR4.58 in an overall slightly higher market.     -Liam Moloney, Dow Jones Newswires; +39 06 678 2543; liam.moloney@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 11:07 ET (15:07 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : OMX: The Nordic Exchange welcomes CellaVision to First North
Story: Trading in CellaVision shares will commence today on First North in Sweden. Including CellaVision, First North now comprises 95 companies.  STOCKHOLM, Sweden--(BUSINESS WIRE)--May 28, 2007--   CellaVision AB develops and markets products for the health care sector, enabling blood cell analysis and quality assurance of morphology diagnosis.     "We warmly welcome CellaVision to First North. Headline: : InterRent REIT Announces Proposed Consolidation/Deconsolidation Of Its Trust Units
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) -    InterRent Real Estate Investment Trust (the "REIT" or "InterRent") (TSX:IIP.UN) today announced that, subject to unitholder approval at its annual and special meeting of its unitholders, to be held June 29, 2007, it will amend its declaration of trust to effect a consolidation (reverse split) of its trust units on a 100:1 basis and the immediate deconsolidation (split) of such units on a 1:100 basis. If approved, the consolidation is scheduled to take place on Sunday, July 8, 2007 and the deconsolidation will follow on Monday, July 9, 2007 at 12:01 a.m. As a result, unitholders holding less than 100 pre-consolidation units will receive a cash payment in exchange for their units equal to the weighted average trading price per unit on the Toronto Stock Exchange for the five trading days prior to July 8, 2007. Unitholders holding 100 or more pre-consolidation units will not be affected by the consolidation/deconsolidation other than to be asked to tender their old unit certificates for a unit certificate bearing the new CUSIP number.    The REIT decided to undertake this program to reduce the large number of unitholders who hold less than 100 units, representing approximately 74% of the total registered and beneficial holders, but only 0.13% of the total outstanding units, which mainly resulted from previous consolidations and business combinations of the corporate predecessors of the REIT. The effect of this proposal is to provide these unitholders with cash representing the value of their holdings without cost or commission, and to eliminate the high costs being incurred by the REIT to issue mailings and distribution cheques to such holders. The REIT estimates that such measures will result in significant savings in administrative costs.    InterRent is also pleased to announce that Maurice Kagan has been nominated to stand for election as a trustee of InterRent at the upcoming meeting of unitholders. Mr. Kagan is currently Chief Executive Officer of Sparkle Solutions Income Fund, a route operator servicing the multi-residential housing industry in Ontario and President of Amadeo Developments Ltd, a developer/builder of affordable housing. Previously he was Vice-President, Corporate with Canadian Apartment Properties Real Estate Investment Trust and prior to that Chief Financial Officer of Residential Equities Real Estate Investment Trust. Mr. Kagan is also a trustee of Carfinco Income Fund and the Chairman of Carfinco's Audit Committee.    InterRent also plans to request unitholder approval for a deferred unit plan and a long term incentive plan and plans to implement a dividend reinvestment plan in the month of June. The meeting of unitholders is scheduled to take place on Friday, June 29, 2007 at 3:30 pm and will be held at the Albany Club, 91 King Street East, Toronto, Ontario. Unitholders will receive information by mail in the coming weeks outlining the details of the consolidation/deconsolidation and any necessary steps that they may be required to take.    About InterRent    InterRent is a rapidly expanding, growth-oriented real estate investment trust engaged in building unitholder value through the accretive acquisition, ownership and operation of strategically located income producing multi-residential real estate, with 3,189 apartment suites under ownership and 384 suites under contract, for a total of 3,563 apartment suites.    This news release contains "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 and applicable Canadian securities legislation concerning the business, operations, financial performance and condition of InterRent. Headline: Brazil's BNDESPar Plans To Sell Brasiliana Stake
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)-BNDESPar, the equity arm of the Brazilian National Development Bank, or BNDES, intends to sell its total stake on the energy holding Companhia Brasiliana de Energia, the energy holding company said Monday in a statement.   Brasiliana de Energia SA is a holding company jointly owned by AES Corp. (AES) and the Brazilian National Development Bank, or BNDES.   Currently, BNDESPar holds a 49.99% stake in Brasiliana, while AES holds a 50.01% majority stake.   In March, BNDESPar said it plans to sell shares of three companies under Brasiliana, including Brazil's largest electric power distributor, Eletropaulo Metropolitana Eletricidade de Sao Paulo SA (ELPL6.BR), AES Tiete (GETI4.BR), and AES Elpa.   BNDESpar also said in March that it had initiated the process to choose a financial institution to coordinate the shares offer; however, it didn't unveil a timetable for the operation.   In December 2003, AES and BNDESPar became partners in Brasiliana Energia as part of an agreement to restructure the debt owed BNDESPar by the three electric companies under the holding.     -By Rogerio Jelmayer, Dow Jones Newswires; 5511-3145-1480; rogerio.jelmayer@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 07:37 ET (11:37 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Philippine Airlines Exercises Option To Buy 2 Boeing 777s
Story: MANILA (Dow Jones)--Philippine Airlines Inc., the country's largest airline by fleet size, said Monday it has exercised its option to purchase two 777-300ER aircraft from Boeing Co. (BA).   The jets were part of a six-plane order that PAL announced in December - two were firm orders, two on option and two to be leased from GE Commercial Aviation Services.   PAL President Jaime Bautista said the purchase of the B777-300ER jets is intended to enhance the airline's service to the U.S.   The list price of a B777-300ER is $250 million, PAL said in December.     -By Cris Larano, Dow Jones Newswires; 632-848-5051; cris.larano@dowjones.com   -Edited by David Bottomley     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 04:03 ET (08:03 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Multichannel Retailer HSN Teams With Hear Music to Create 30-Minute Television Special in Honor of New Paul McCartney Release of Memory Almost Full
Story: Limited Edition DVD/CD Set Available For Pre-Order During Special Paul McCartney Listening Party May 30 Leading Up to June 5 Official Release       ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., May 28 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Multichannel retailing powerhouse HSN today announced that it is teaming with Hear Music to produce a Paul McCartney Listening Party television special to celebrate the upcoming release of Paul McCartney's latest album, Memory Almost Full. Scheduled to air May 30 at 8 p.m. and May 31 at 1:30 a.m. and 2:30 p.m., the special 30-minute program will feature cuts from the new CD, lively discussions with McCartney fans and video segments from Paul McCartney as he shares the inspiration behind his latest work.     The first new studio album from McCartney in nearly two years, Memory Almost Full is also the inaugural CD release from Hear Music, the record label formed between Starbucks Entertainment and Concord Music Group.  Memory Almost Full will be available for order during the listening party on HSN and HSN.com as part of a limited edition DVD/CD set ($24,98) that includes three bonus tracks, behind-the-scenes footage of McCartney in the recording studio and a special audio commentary.     For more information about the Paul McCartney Listening Party on HSN, or to purchase the Paul McCartney Memory Almost Full Limited Edition DVD/CD set, log on to http://www.hsn.com as of May 30.     Memory Almost Full will be available at Starbucks locations and traditional music retail outlets internationally. It will be released in the U.S. and Canada on June 5 and in all other countries and territories the week of June 4.        About Hear Music:     Hear Music is an innovative record label and partnership between Starbucks Entertainment and Concord Music Group.  Rooted in quality, authenticity and passion, Hear Music works directly with artists, both emerging and established, to bring quality music to the widest possible audience, in both Starbucks locations and traditional music retailers worldwide.        About HSN:     The originator of the electronic retailing concept in 1977, HSN, an operating business of IAC (Nasdaq: IACI), is a global multichannel retailing giant offering thousands of products to enhance all aspects of its customers lives.  On HSN and hsn.com, customers can find an array of unique products and brand names in categories such as Beauty (e.g., Sephora, H2O+ Cosmetics, Ken Paves, Paula Dorf); Jewelry (e.g., R.J. Graziano, Michael Anthony, Cameron Cohen, Elini); Home/Lifestyle (e.g., Dyson, Todd English, ProForm, Wolfgang Puck, Reebok, Bob Vila, Roy Yamaguchi); Fashion (e.g.. Randolph Duke, Tommy Hilfiger, Carlos Falchi, Beverly Feldman); and Electronics (e.g., Gateway, Panasonic, Sharp, JVC).  HSN delivers its merchandise across multiple platforms, including TV, where the network reaches 89 million households and is the 4th largest cable network in the U.S.; online, and through hsn.com, which also features value-added video-on-demand and podcasts of products, shows, and tips.    SOURCE  HSN       /CONTACT: Brad Bohnert of HSN, +1-727-872-7515, Brad.bohnert@hsn.net; or Doug Cavarocchi of Starbucks Entertainment, +1-206-318-7100, Press@starbucks.com; or Allison Elbl of I-D Public Relations, +1-323-822-4851, aelbl@id-pr.com; or Joel Amsterdam of Concord Music Group, +1-310-385-4206, jamsterdam@concordrecords.com      /Web site: http://www.hsn.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 11:00 ET (15:00 GMT)

Headline: Venezuela Reviews Steel Co's Cost Structure; Talks Continue
Story: By Raul Gallegos   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     CARACAS (Dow Jones)--Venezuela is now looking into the finances of steel company Sidor to determine a fair domestic price for its product and the profit margins the company could earn in the future, the mining minister said Monday.   "(An acceptable profit margin) is what we're debating. The government is discussing those percentages with them. We will decide (a percentage) there at the negotiating table," Mining Minister Jose Khan told Dow Jones Newswires in a telephone interview.   Sidor is expected to furnish the government with a detailed financial report Monday and talks will continue, Khan said, but he could not say when they will reach an agreement. The talks also include the terms of a deal to determine a new price for the iron ore the state sells to Sidor. Officials at Sidor could not be contacted for comment.   President Hugo Chavez has threatened to seize the company if it fails to offer low-cost steel to local producers and doesn't begin paying a higher price for state-supplied iron ore. The future of the company and a possible nationalization, the government has said, is now in the hands of Sidor executives.   Sidor is owned by Argentine-Italian conglomerate Techint through its subsidiary company Ternium (TX). Many observers in Venezuela and Argentina believe the company may manage to avoid being nationalized due to the political alliance between Chavez and Argentine President Nestor Kirchner.   "I really don't want to be forced to nationalize Sidor," Chavez said recently but he has threatened the company with nationalization once before. In 2005 he warned the company it would have to pay more money for the iron ore supplied by state-owned Ferrominera del Orinoco or face a takeover. Sidor managed to work out new sale terms with the state shortly after.   But a standing agreement between Sidor and the Venezuelan government in effect allows the steel company to pay 27% less than the international price for iron ore.   "That accord number 3895 expires in July. We will review that agreement and determine a new one early," Khan said.   As the deal stands, the minister said Sidor receives a 5% discount based on the quality of some material, then another 15% for having struck an agreement with the state. Sidor gets an additional 7% discount for developing an "industrial development plan."   Khan did not mention details of what the new deal will look like. He also insisted that it is no longer acceptable to have Sidor sell steel to local producers "at a level that exceeds the international price."   Techint officials have visited the country lately to join the talks with the government in hopes of avoiding a nationalization. Members of the company's union, however, are asking Chavez to go ahead and nationalize the steel producer.     -By Raul Gallegos, Dow Jones Newswires; +58-212-564-1339; raul.gallegos@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 13:18 ET (17:18 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Sparx To Drop Call For Pentax Pres Departure From Bd - Nikkei
Story: TOKYO (Nikkei)--Sparx Group Co. (8739.JA), the largest investor in Pentax Corp. (7750.TO), has decided to drop as early as Wednesday its proposal calling for Pentax President Takashi Watanuki to leave the board, The Nikkei reported in its Tuesday morning edition.   The asset management firm is withdrawing its shareholder proposal because its demands are being met.  All eight of the camera maker's directors, including Watanuki, announced that they would quit to assume responsibility for confusion after optical glass maker Hoya Corp. (7741.TO) announced plans to launch a tender offer for the company.   Watanuki had initially expressed his intention to remain at his post.  But Sparx, which supports the tender offer, has been calling for the resignation of those not enthusiastic about an integration between Pentax and Hoya, including Watanuki and others.   Pentax decided that the departure of Watanuki and his lieutenants is necessary in order to avoid a proxy fight over selecting new directors.  It proposed two Pentax officials as new board members, one of which would become the new president.  It also said that it will receive two directors from Hoya, in addition to two outside directors.   Sparx invests in Pentax through an overseas fund, and it is expected to drop its shareholder proposal once the fund reaches a decision on the matter.  Pentax is poised to hold a board meeting on Thursday to approve Hoya's tender offer and decide on board candidates.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 15:44 ET (19:44 GMT)

Headline: Canada Liberals Urge Review Of Foreign Takeover Rules
Story: OTTAWA (Dow Jones)--Canada's opposition Liberals Monday urged the government not to decide on major foreign takeovers of Canadian firms until it appoints a panel of experts to review the rules and makes recommendations.   The call comes in the wake of a spate of foreign takeovers of Canadian firms over the last year.   On May 7, New York-headquartered Alcoa Inc. (AA) launched a $27 billion hostile takeover for Montreal-based Alcan Inc. (AL). Alcan's board on May 22 urged shareholders to reject the offer on the grounds it was too low and that its completion was too uncertain due to regulatory hurdles.    "We suggest that the government first appoint a blue ribbon panel of experts to review the issues and make recommendations on changes to the Investment Canada Act within three months," Liberal leader Stephane Dion said at a news conference.   "The government should hold back decisions on major foreign acquisitions and any changes to foreign ownership rules until after this process has been completed."   At the same time, the Liberals also want a special sub-committee of the Finance and Industry Committees to hold hearings on the issue through the summer.   -Nirmala Menon, Dow Jones Newswires; 613-237-0668; nirmala.menon@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 10:14 ET (14:14 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: World Bank Lender: Amazon Beef Trend To Continue
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--The Amazon biome of Brazil is increasingly becoming a haven for local beef companies, and the trend is unlikely to change soon, a World Bank lender told Dow Jones Newswires on Monday.   "Brazilian beef companies are spending more time on the Amazon region, and that's only going to increase as time goes on. Some of the hamburgers you eat will come from cattle roaming what was Amazon jungle a few decades ago," said Marcelo Lessa, senior investment officer for agribusiness lending at the International Finance Corporation, the private equity arm of the World Bank.   That doesn't mean ranchers and Brazil's top meat corporations will be cutting down virgin rainforest to grow cattle instead. Most of the big Brazilian beef players already have meat-packing units in the Amazon biome, whether it's in the small western states of Acre and Rondonia or the southeastern half of Para state, a massive state in the heart of the Amazon. Many of the areas where cattle now roam are in the south and southeast of the Amazon, and have been deforested for years. But growing pressure from cattle could increase deforestation without proper land management, livestock analysts like Alcides Torres of Scot Consultoria have said.   This year, the IFC lent $90 million to Grupo Bertin, the second-largest beef exporter in Brazil, to upgrade its facilities in Maraba, Para, a small city on the Tocantins River which hasn't been jungle for decades.   "Since that loan became public, we've received requests by big beef companies here for similar proposals," Lessa said. Brazil is the world's leading beef exporter.   The IFC's loan requires Bertin to certify its cattle purchases and guarantee buyers that the beef did not come from recently deforested lands.   IFC gave Bertin $1 million in grant cash to help small and mid-sized ranchers practice sustainable ranching and increase their per-acre head count, meaning they can increase the herd without clearing new land. The IFC and Bertin count on Amazon watchdog groups like Greenpeace Amazon and Conservation International for advice on how to assure Bertin, and its suppliers, are being good stewards of the environment and obeying local labor laws. The IFC has roughly eight employees dedicated to the Bertin project.   "We are small financiers in the Amazon. Most of the investments are all mid-scale and private, so the ultimate question on the Amazon becomes what those private investors are going to do with their investments," Lessa said.   "We'd prefer to bring more companies in the region into the IFC loop, so we can require they follow some best practices for labor and the environment," he said.   Other than individual investors ramping up Amazon operations in various sectors of the economy, Amazon beef's future rests on European, Russian and Middle Eastern consumers demanding that their steaks came from certified companies committed to keeping more trees in the rainforest than cattle.   "Amazon beef is here to stay now. That's where (organizations) like Greenpeace come in to raise awareness. We'd prefer that Amazon beef is eventually treated like dolphin-free Tuna," Lessa said. Dolphins are often killed by commercial tuna boats because it is easier for them to find schools of tuna in areas where dolphins are feeding, trapping them in nets. Dolphins are mammals and will drown if unable to surface for air. The U.S. and Europe have embargoed tuna companies from selling tuna that is not "dolphin-safe."    This month, southern Para state was labeled free of foot-and-mouth disease by the World Organization for Animal Health in Paris. All bets are on that Para will become one of Brazil's top beef exporters in the coming years thanks to cheap land and growing cattle herds. Para is becoming more attractive for both international-minded Brazil beef companies like Grupo Friboi (JBSS3.BR) and Bertin.   Lessa said more Amazon beef proposals are on the table, but in early stages of analysis at this time.     -By Kenneth Rapoza; Dow Jones Newswires; 55-11-3145-1488; ken.rapoza@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 14:29 ET (18:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : DALSA And RIM To Jointly Develop Lands In Waterloo>DSA.T
Story: WATERLOO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - DALSA Corporation (TSX:DSA) today announced they have signed a definitive agreement with Research In Motion (RIM) to jointly develop lands in Waterloo Ontario.    As part of the agreement, which is expected to close within the next several months, RIM will purchase approximately 37 acres of land from DALSA at the intersection of University Avenue East and Northfield Drive East in Waterloo, and plans to use it for future expansion. DALSA, which owns approximately 19 adjacent acres, has similar plans in the future. The two parcels of land will be jointly developed by the two companies.    "It is fantastic that DALSA and RIM are working together to develop the lands in Waterloo," commented Savvas Chamberlain, CEO of DALSA Corporation. "The agreement reflects the collective confidence we both have in our future growth and our commitment to the City of Waterloo and the Waterloo Region, which I believe benefit in many ways from the success of growing high tech companies."    Jim Balsillie, Co-CEO of Research In Motion added, "We are extremely pleased to share this news following Waterloo's recognition as the world's Top Intelligent Community. RIM is excited at the prospects of its business and the opportunities for growth in Waterloo, and we look forward to working with DALSA to develop this property."    About DALSA Corporation    DALSA is an international leader in high performance digital imaging and semiconductors with more than 1000 employees world-wide. Established in 1980, the Company designs, develops, manufactures, and markets digital imaging products and solutions, in addition to providing semiconductor products and services. DALSA's core competencies are in specialized integrated circuit and electronics technology, software, and highly engineered semiconductor wafer processing. Products and services include image sensor components (CCD and CMOS); electronic digital cameras; vision processors; image processing software; and semiconductor wafer foundry services for use in MEMS, high-voltage semiconductors, image sensors and mixed-signal CMOS chips. DALSA is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol "DSA" and has its corporate offices in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada.                   FOR FURTHER INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT:             DALSA Corporation           Patrick Myles           Director, Corporate Communications           (519) 886-6001 Ext. 2177           Email: patrick.myles@dalsa.com           Website: www.dalsa.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 08:33 ET (12:33 GMT)

Headline: California's HealthCare Partners Puts Doctor Fees On Web Site
Story: TORRANCE, Calif. (AP)--Breaking with long-held medical tradition, a Southern California physicians group has become one of the first and largest health organizations in the nation to make prices for procedures easily available to the public.   HealthCare Partners put an itemized price list on its Web site last week, with little fanfare.   "It feels like the right thing to do," said Robert Margolis, a founding physician and chief executive of the medical group.   The Torrance-based company serves more than 500,000 patients, who can now learn without asking that a flu vaccine runs $15, a chest X-ray goes for $61, and a colonoscopy costs $424.   The page can be accessed easily by clicking on "fees for basic services."   The move was spurred in part by the growth of walk-in clinics at malls and Wal Marts that provide simple medical services like vaccines and ultrasounds and make no secret of their prices.   Doctors have at times thought the practice of publicizing prices was undignified and crassly commercial, and patients with insurance often haven't cared about particular prices beyond their co-payments and premiums.   But with employers increasingly shifting more costs to workers, the numbers have begun to matter more.   "Before, if you had a $10 or $5 co-pay, it didn't hit your pocketbook," said Chris Ohman, chief executive of the California Association of Health Plans, a trade group that represents insurers. "But if now you have to pay the first $2,000, the cost of an office visit matters to you a lot more."   Some insurance companies, including Aetna Inc. (AET), have posted prices online for some regions.   HealthCare Partners hopes potential customers will appreciate their tranparency and recognize the value of a physicians group over a walk-in clinic.   "It shows them, 'This is why I'm paying more,' "said health care consultant Mary Kay Scott. "They are giving me more."     Web site: http://www.healthcarepartners.com/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 07:54 ET (11:54 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UniCredit May Seek Acquisitions In Germany - Newspaper
Story: FRANKFURT (Dow Jones)--Italian bank UniCredit Spa (UC.MI) wants to get its house in order in Germany, management board member Dieter Rampl told Sueddeutsche Zeitung's Tuesday edition.   "Germany has the highest priority for the group," he said, adding, "At the moment we're growing mostly organically, but we will also be looking around Germany for acquisitions." Sueddeutsche quoted Rampl as saying UniCredit's share of private-client business in Germany is too small.   Rampl said he could also imagine other European acquisitions, although the bank was now focused on its takeover of Capitalia.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.sueddeutsche.de     -Frankfurt Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 49-69-29725-500.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 10:22 ET (14:22 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Vimicro And Microsoft Strengthen Working Alliance In China To Develop Digital Multimedia Market>VIMC
Story: BEIJING, May 28 /Xinhua-PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Vimicro Corporation (Nasdaq: VIMC), a leading fabless semiconductor company designing advanced mixed-signal multimedia products and solutions, and Microsoft China, reaffirmed their strategic partnership during a ceremony in Beijing on May 24. The companies are continuing to cooperate in the Microsoft-Vimicro Multimedia Technology Center, originally established in 2003 within Vimicro's Beijing headquarters, and are expanding the scope of their work together to include the mobile multimedia sector.  Mike Yu, vice president of Vimicro is appointed as the Dean of Microsoft-Vimicro Multimedia Technology Center.        (Logo: http://www.newscom.com/cgi-bin/prnh/20070528/CNM014LOGO )     Vimicro and Microsoft China are finalizing a Memorandum of Understanding to increase their joint efforts in further developing the digital multimedia market.  One goal of the Microsoft-Vimicro Multimedia Technology Center is to enable Vimicro's multimedia processors to be compiled to the requirements of Windows Vista drivers and be ready to get Windows Vista logo certification.     "Vimicro is honored to be Microsoft's ongoing partner," said Dr. John Deng, chairman and founder of Vimicro.  "Over the past four years, Microsoft and Vimicro have experienced great successes.  As a result of our collaboration, Vimicro has earned international recognition for the quality of our products at a faster rate and Chinese Ministry of Information Industry's recognition as the outstanding representative of Chinese IC design industry. Together, Vimicro and Microsoft are continuing to cooperate in multimedia area and expand the international digital multimedia market."     Dr. Ya-Qin Zhang, corporate vice president of Microsoft and chairman of Microsoft China Research and Development Group stated, "Technology innovation is essential to China's sustainable economic development.  Microsoft desires to contribute to China's innovation blueprint by developing a flourishing IT eco-system through collaborating with partners on innovation.  Vimicro is one of the outstanding independent innovation representatives in China.  Through combining the innovation thoughts, strength and experience together, we're confident that this new collaboration will continue to provide world-class digital multimedia experiences to consumers."     Through their partnership over the past four years, Vimicro and Microsoft have cooperated in real-time multimedia communications and 3C convergence areas.  The collaboration has already resulted in breakthrough PC-camera and embedded notebook-camera solutions.     Vimicro and Microsoft began collaborating in 2002, when they formed a strategic partnership to promote Windows-based digital imaging technology in the worldwide market.  The partnership combined Vimicro's VXP imaging technology with the Windows XP platform to provide an enhanced multimedia experience for PC-users worldwide.        About Vimicro     Vimicro International Corporation is a leading fabless semiconductor company in China designing, developing and marketing proprietary digital multimedia signal processing chips and solutions enabling multimedia applications for mobile phones over 2.5G/3G networks and PCs over broadband Internet.    http://www.vimicro.com/english        About Microsoft     Founded in 1975, Microsoft (Nasdaq: MSFT) is the worldwide leader in software, services and solutions that help people and businesses realize their full potential.    http://www.microsoft.com    SOURCE  Vimicro Corporation     /CONTACT: Meghan Weber or Nicole Blake of Stanton Communications, +1-212-616-3601, or mweber@stantoncomm.com or nblake@stantoncomm.com, for Vimicro Corporation; or Sheena Shen or Haizhen Du of Vimicro Corporation, +86-10-6894-8888, or sheenshen@vimicro.com or duhaizhen@vimicro.com      /Web site: http://www.vimicro.com/english      /Web site: http://www.microsoft.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 08:45 ET (12:45 GMT)

Headline: STREET MOVES: Blackmont Hires Dalton To Head Up Bking Ops
Story: TORONTO (Dow Jones)--Blackmont Capital, a full-service brokerage firm, has moved to bolster its investment-banking operations, bringing aboard Kevin Dalton as managing director and head of the division.   Dalton takes over from Grant White, who was more interested in focusing primarily on generating business and working with clients for the Toronto-based dealer. White will also continue to sit on the management committee for Capital Markets at Blackmont, as well as Blackmont's new names-underwriting committee.   Dalton is expected to join Blackmont, a unit of Toronto-based money-management firm CI Financial Income Fund (CIX.UN.T), at the beginning of July.   Dalton was most recently the head of diversified industries with the investment-banking division of CIBC World Markets, the dealer arm of Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CM).   Company Web Site: http://www.ci.com     -Ben Dummett, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2024; ben.dummett@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 14:44 ET (18:44 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: New Zealand Scientists Breed Cows That Produce Low-Fat Milk
Story: WELLINGTON (AP)--New Zealand scientists are breeding a herd of cows that produce lower-fat milk after the chance discovery of a natural gene mutation in one animal.   Milk from the cows is also high in health-boosting omega-3 fatty acids and makes butter that spreads as easily as margarine even when chilled, biotechnology company Vialactia said Monday.   Scientists discovered a cow, later named Marge by researchers, carrying the mutant gene in a dairy herd they were testing in 2001, said Vialactia's chief scientist, Russell Snell.   Vialactia, a subsidiary of the Fonterra Cooperative Group, one of the world's largest milk companies, bought the cow for NZ$300 and moved it to a research site.   While she looked like any other Friesian cow, testing revealed that Marge's milk contained about 1% fat, compared with about 3.5% for whole milk.   Offspring from the cow also produce low-fat milk, showing the genetic trait is dominant, Snell said.   Scientists have yet to isolate the exact chemical pathway responsible for the naturally produced low-fat milk, Snell said.   "Every now and then nature throws up these sorts of things and it was simply a case of us being in the right place at the right time," he said.   The company expects the first commercial herd of cows supplying natural low-fat milk and spreadable butter for the market by 2011.       (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 02:59 ET (06:59 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Lauder Announces Candidacy To Lead World Jewish Congress
Story: JERUSALEM (AP)--American businessman Ronald Lauder says he'll run for president of the World Jewish Congress.   Lauder, a billionaire and heir to the cosmetics empire Estee Lauder Cos. (EL), hopes to replace Edgar M. Bronfman Sr., who resigned earlier this month amid a bitter internal feud.   The infighting revolved around Bronfman's firing of longtime deputy Rabbi Israel Singer, who was incriminated in a 2006 report by the New York attorney general that found he improperly used WJC funds for personal use. No criminal charges were filed against Singer.   The World Jewish Congress said Bronfman intends to step down in June, and that a committee would consider candidates to fill the position.   Lauder currently serves as president of the American arm of the Jewish National Fund, a nonprofit organization that acts as a caretaker for the lands of Israel.   "The tough facts cannot be denied, the activities of the Congress have been disrupted recently by the differences of opinions and scandals," Lauder said in a statement Sunday. "This is certainly one of the reasons that I decided to offer my candidacy for the position."   Founded in 1936, the World Jewish Congress is known for fighting anti-Semitism, and lobbying to allow the Jews of the Soviet Union to emigrate.   ---   On the Net:   http://www.worldjewishcongress.org/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 01:57 ET (05:57 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Angloplat Resumes Wage Talks With S African Unions - I-Net
Story: JOHANNESBURG (I-Net Bridge)--Anglo Platinum Ltd. (AMS.JO) has resumed wage talks with unions Monday and Impala Platinum Holdings Ltd. (IMPUY) will begin its negotiations with South African unions on June 4, company representatives have confirmed to I-Net Bridge.    Anglo Platinum - the world's biggest platinum producer - began wage talks on May 16 but they were adjourned until Monday, revealing a big gap between what the company was offering and what unions were demanding.    In its initial offer, the company offered a 5% pay rise to workers falling under the bargaining council agreement plus 30% of monthly salary as a once-off lump sum payment.    This was well short of demands from the three major unions. The National Union of Mineworkers' opening demand was 15%, Solidarity asked for 18% and the United Associations of South Africa  wanted a pay rise of 20%.    Meanwhile, Impala Platinum's human resources head, Mike Teke, said talks between the world's second largest platinum producer and unions would begin at 10am on Monday, June 4. Negotiations between the Chamber of Mines and several leading gold and coal producers are expected begin in mid June.    It is expected that company and union negotiators will pay close attention to the wage dispute between the government and public servants which may lead to nationwide strike action if agreement is not reached by Friday, June 1.    The government's offer of a 6% pay rise has been unanimously rejected by unions who are looking for a 12% hike.   I-Net Bridge, Tel: +27-11-280-0730, newsdesk@inet.co.za     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 05:18 ET (09:18 GMT)

Headline: Arriscraft To Be Acquired By General Shale Brick For C$107M
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Arriscraft International Income Fund (AIN.UN.T) has agreed to sell its Arriscraft International manufactured stone, brick and natural stone masonry products business to General Shale Brick Inc. for C$107 million (US$99.1 million).   The fund said it will be responsible to pay transaction and wind-up related expenses out of the sale proceeds received from General Shale.   General Shale, Johnson City, Tenn., is an affiliate of Austrian brick company Wienerberger AG (WIE.VI).   The fund said most of the proceeds from the sale will be paid to unitholders through the redemption of all outstanding fund units at about C$7.50 a unit, which represents a premium of about 26.7% over the 20-day average price for the period ended May 4.   The redemption is expected to occur by the end of July.   The fund's board has approved the transaction and will recommend that the fund's unitholders approve the transaction. Holders of about 27.8% of the fund's outstanding units have agreed to vote in favor of the proposed sale.   -Judy McKinnon; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 08:19 ET (12:19 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : La Mancha Completes The Renewal Of The Ity Mine's Mining Permit>LMA.T
Story: MONTREAL, QUEBEC--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - La Mancha Resources Inc. (TSX:LMA) (hereinafter "La Mancha" or the "Company") reports that an agreement was reached last Friday between the Company, SODEMI, its current co-owner of the Ity mine, and the Ivorian authorities regarding the terms and conditions of the Ity mine's permit renewal.    According to this agreement, the mining permit of the Ity mine will be re-conducted until November 2013 with the following changes for La Mancha:    - In accordance with the Ivorian mining law of 1995 that governs the grant of mining permits, the co-owners of the Ity mine have agreed to transfer to the government 10% of their respective interest in the mine as of Friday. Consequently, La Mancha's ownership in the Ity mine is now reduced to 45.9%, SODEMI's ownership is reduced to 44.1% while the Ivorian government, gains a 10% ownership in the mine.    - Following the reduction of La Mancha's participation in the mine, the Company's influential status will change from controlling company to joint control of the Ity mine with its partners. Therefore, the Ity mine financial results will be presented following a proportionate consolidation method starting at the signing date of the shareholder's agreement, in accordance with the Canadian GAAP. The previously released financial information should not be affected by this change in ownership.    - La Mancha's attributable gold production target for the Ity mine in 2007 has been revised from 21,400 ounces to 19,800 ounces of gold and consequently, La Mancha's total attributable production target for 2007 is revised to 75,300 ounces of gold.    In order to minimize the impacts of this ownership re-organization on the performance of the mine, the three co-owners of the mine have entered into a management agreement detailing their respective roles and obligations. The key provisions of this management agreement are as follows:    - For the first year, the General Manager of the mine will be appointed by the co-owners upon a proposal of La Mancha. After that period, the General Manager will be appointed upon a proposal of the Ivorian parties while the appointment of the Deputy General Manager will be based on La Mancha's proposal.    - The main decisions will be taken by the Board of the mine by a qualified majority involving at least one representative of each side (La Mancha and Ivorian representative).    - La Mancha will also appoint the Technical Director as well as the Controller.    Mr Michel Cuilhe, President and CEO of La Mancha noted: "This renewed long term stability at the Ity mine allows La Mancha to envisage new ways of unlocking the value of this high potential asset. We are looking forward to work with our two partners at increasing reserves and resources and at improving the performance of the mine."    ABOUT LA MANCHA RESOURCES Inc.:    La Mancha Resources Inc. is an international gold producer based in Canada with operations, development projects and exploration activities in Africa, Australia and in Argentina.The ITY mine, located in Cote d'Ivoire, was inaugurated in 1991 and has produced more than 650,000 ounces of gold to date. La Mancha's shares trade on the Toronto (TSX) under the symbol "LMA". For more information on the company, you may visit the web at www.lamancha.ca .    Caution Concerning Forward-Looking Statements    This press release contains certain "forward-looking statements", including, but not limited to, the statements regarding the Company's strategic plans, future commercial production, the terms and conditions of its Ivorian mining permit, it's future ownership in the Ity mine, it's ability to influence the management of the Ity mine, more importantly the appointment of its key managers, the future stability of La Mancha's Ivorian operations and the plans to pursue their development; the impact of the change in ownership on the Company's previous financial statements. Headline: : TAM Receives Three More Airbus A320s
Story: The company has incorporated 14 aircraft into its fleet this year       SAO PAULO, Brazil, May 28 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- TAM (NYSE: TAM) (Bovespa: TAMM4) received three more Airbus A320s last weekend, which are being incorporated into its operational fleet. This year, TAM has already received 14 aircraft -- eleven in the A320/319 family and three MD-11s. With these acquisitions, the company will have 85 Airbus models -- 15 A319s, 60 A320s and 10 A330s.        (Logo:  http://www.newscom.com/cgi-bin/prnh/20060418/SPTU001LOGO )     With the arrival of the three Airbus A320s, TAM increases its fleet to 105 aircraft (85 Airbus, 17 F-100s and 3 MD-11s). The company plans to end 2007 with 112 planes in operation.     The company's new fleet planning forecasts the inclusion of 32 aircraft during this year (14 already delivered). During 1Q07 results presentation, the company announced the acquisition of three more wide-body Airbus by the end of 2007, in addition to other two already programmed and it will increase the number of international long haul routes operation aircraft to 18 - 15 Airbus and 3 MD-11. The company estimates that it will increase its international market capacity (ASKs) by 70% during 2007.     TAM has also signed contracts with Airbus for the inclusion of another 54 aircraft, with deliveries scheduled through 2010. The contracts also include 20 options for planes in the A320 family, which may be exercised by the company in accordance with the market's growth. TAM also announced the acquisition of four new Boeing 777-300ERs and another four options, with delivery forecast for next year. TAM's strategic planning forecasts an operating fleet of 141 aircraft in 2011.     Used on domestic routes and for destinations in South America operated by TAM, the new A320s cater to the increased demand seen in the last months. In the first four months of this year, air passenger traffic on the domestic market grew 13.8%. In the same period, TAM grew 26.8% in relation to the previous year, according to official data from the National Civil Aviation Agency (ANAC -- Agencia Nacional de Aviacao Civil).        About TAM:     TAM (http://www.tam.com.br) has been the leader in the Brazilian domestic market for more than three years, and closed April 2007 with a 50.7% domestic market share and a 69.7% international market share. The company operates flights to 49 destinations throughout Brazil. It serves 76 different cities in the domestic market through regional alliances. Additionally, it maintains code-share agreements with international airline companies that allow passengers to travel to a large number of destinations throughout the world. TAM was the first Brazilian airline company to launch a loyalty program. Currently, the program has over 4.0 million subscribers and has awarded 4.3 million tickets in exchange for points.    SOURCE  TAM       /CONTACT: Investors, (55) (11) 5582-9715, Fax, (55) (11) 5582-8149, invest@tam.com.br, www.tam.com.br/ri, Media, (55) (11) 5582-8167, Fax, (55) (11) 5582-8155, tamimprensa@tam.com.br, both of TAM      /Web site: http://www.tam.com.br     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 12:07 ET (16:07 GMT)

Headline: TNT To Delist From New York Stock Exchange
Story: Edited Press Release     AMSTERDAM (Dow Jones)--TNT NV announced that its Board of Management, approved by its Supervisory Board, has decided to apply for deregistration of the company and termination of its reporting obligations under the U.S. Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the "Exchange Act") and the delisting of its American Depositary Receipts ("ADRs") from the New York Stock Exchange (the "NYSE").   TNT intends to file a Form 15F with the SEC to deregister and terminate its reporting obligations under the Exchange Act as soon as practicable following June 4, 2007, the date when the revised SEC rules on deregistration become effective. By operation of law, the deregistration will be effective 90 days after the filing, unless the Form 15F is earlier withdrawn. TNT reserves the right to delay the filing of the Form 15F or withdraw the Form 15F for any reason prior to its effectiveness.   TNT intends to file a Form 25 with the SEC to effect the delisting as soon as practicable following June 4, 2007.   The company intends to maintain its American Depositary Receipt facility as a Level I programme. This means that TNT's ADRs will be traded on the over-the-counter market. TNT's ordinary shares will continue to be traded on Euronext Amsterdam.   TNT will continue to publish its Annual Report, Accounts and communications in accordance with the Exchange Act.     Company Web Site http://group.tnt.com.       (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 05:00 ET (09:00 GMT)

Headline: Chile Escondida Mine Seeks Delay In Water Project Evaluation
Story: SANTIAGO (Dow Jones)--Chilean copper mine Escondida, the world's largest open-pit copper mine, requested a delay in the environmental impact evaluation of a key water supply project, a mine spokeswoman said Monday.   As part of the normal environmental evaluation process, Escondida sought a suspension to properly answer the environmental authority's queries, the company spokeswoman added.   Through the proposed $300 million Pampa Colorada water project, Escondida will increase water supply to the mine.   The mining company now has a July 31 deadline to provide environmental authorities additional information, following evaluation guidelines, the spokeswoman said.   The Pampa Colorada project has come under fire from local communities who fear their water supply will suffer when Escondida begins to extract more water.   Copper mining requires vast amounts of water to extract the mineral from the crushed rock. Most mining outfits in Chile are located in the arid northern regions, where water supply isn't abundant.   Last year, Escondida produced 1,255,559 metric tons of copper, a 1.3% decrease from 2005, as a result of a month-long strike.   Escondida is owned 57.5% by Anglo-Australian mining giant BHP Billiton, 30% by Anglo-Australian company Rio Tinto PLC (RTP), 10% by a Mitsubishi Corp. (8058.TO)-led Japanese consortium and 2.5% by the International Finance Corp.   Chile accounts for more than a third of global copper output, making it the world's biggest producer of the metal.     Company Web site: http://www.escondida.cl     -By Carolina Pica, Dow Jones Newswires; 56-2-460-8544; carolina.pica@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 11:18 ET (15:18 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Nevsun: Tabakoto Mine Plant, Ops May Need To Be Suspended
Story: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - Nevsun Resources Ltd. (TSX:NSU)(AMEX:NSU) ("Nevsun") wishes to advise that due to a water shortage at its water pumping station on the Faleme River in Mali, the Tabakoto Mine process plant and associated operations will likely need to be suspended sometime during the next few days. The seasonal rains have not yet started in the Kenieba district where the Tabakoto Mine is located, and the plant water reservoir has been depleted by higher than anticipated evaporation rates.    Tabakoto Mine management is assessing the impact on the remaining operations, including maintenance scheduling. Seasonal rains normally commence in May with heavier rains from June through to September. Plant operations should recommence as soon as water becomes available on the Faleme River. Headline: : Sify Appoints Arvind Mathur as Chief Architect Global Services
Story: CHENNAI, India--(BUSINESS WIRE)--May 28, 2007--   Sify Limited (Nasdaq National Market: SIFY), a leader in consumer Internet and Enterprise Services in India with global delivery capabilities, announced today the appointment of Arvind Mathur as its Chief Architect-Global Services. He will be based in Delhi and will be responsible for architecting services, solutions and the product portfolio across the company's business lines, including evolution of the core network infrastructure to support next generation, managed IP services and applications for global customers.     Commenting on his appointment, Mr Raju Vegesna, CEO and Managing Director, Sify Limited, said, "I am pleased to welcome Arvind to Sify. Arvind joins us at a crucial juncture when the company has aggressive plans to grow internationally. As the Chief Architect-Global Services he will be responsible for enhancing Sify's technology and service offerings. He will be involved in design and development of products and services across businesses. Given his excellent track record, I am confident Sify's product lines will see robust growth in both width and depth."     Mr Arvind Mathur said, " I am excited to join Sify at a time when the Company is poised for great growth. I am confident my technical and management expertise coupled with many years of international experience will prove to be very relevant in my present role as Chief Architect-Global Services, Sify. I look forward to contributing in developing and deploying product and services strategy and constructing strong technical expertise that will place Sify at the forefront in the global arena."     Arvind brings with him over 17 years of international experience in the telecommunications and networking arena having worked with major telecom and network services providers; innovation and development centers; and network equipment providers. His prior assignments include stints at the Research Institute of Electrical Communication (Japan), Advanced Fibre Communications, Teleglobe Inc (USA), JDS Uniphase Inc (Canada) and Bharti Airtel Limited. Prior to joining Sify, Arvind was Vice President and Head of Global Product Management, Network Services for the Enterprise Business Division at Tata-VSNL.     Arvind holds a Masters Degree in Electrical Communication Engineering from the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore and a Masters Degree in Physics from the Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi specializing in Optical Communication and Optoelectronics.       About Sify     Sify is among the largest Internet, network and e-Commerce services companies in India, offering end-to-end solutions with a comprehensive range of products delivered over a common Internet backbone infrastructure. This Internet backbone reaches 188 cities and towns in India. A significant part of the company's revenue is derived from Corporate Services, which include corporate connectivity, network and communications solutions, security, network management services, enterprise applications and hosting. A host of blue chip customers use Sify's corporate service offerings. Consumer services include broadband home access, dial up connectivity and the iWay cyber cafe chain across 158 cities and towns. Sify is recognized as an ISO 9001:2000 certified service provider for network operations, data center operations and customer support, and for provisioning of     VPNs, Internet bandwidth, VoIP Solutions and integrated security solutions, and BS7799 certified for Internet Data Center operations.       For more information about Sify, visit www.sifycorp.com       Forward Looking Statements:     This press release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. The forward-looking statements contained herein are subject to risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those reflected in the forward-looking statements. Sify undertakes no duty to update any forward-looking statements.     For a discussion of the risks associated with Sify's business, please see the discussion under the caption "Risks Related to Our Business" in the company's report on Form 6-K for the quarter ended December 31, 2006, which has been filed with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission and is available by accessing the database maintained by the SEC at www.sec.gov.
