Headline: Ico Therapeutics Could Price IPO This Week: Source
Story: By Andy Georgiades     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     TORONTO (Dow Jones)--Vancouver-based biotech iCo Therapeutics Inc. could price its initial public offering this week, a source said.   The company, which filed its prospectus at the beginning of May, is aiming to raise about C$15 million and price its shares in the range of C$2-C$2.20, the source said.   The deal is being led by Cormark Securities Inc. (formerly Sprott Securities).   According to its Web site, iCo "aims to acquire the rights to drugs that are either off-patent, currently approved or near commercialization and develop them by redosing or reformulating them for new uses in isolated biological environments."   Its lead drug is iCo-007, which was licensed from California-based Isis Pharmaceuticals Inc. (ISIS) for the treatment of eye diseases caused by the formation of new blood vessels, such as age-related macular degneration and diabetic retinopathy. The drug, a second-generation antisense compound, is expected to go into a Phase I/II trial this year.   Company Web Site: http://www.icotherapeutics.com     -Andy Georgiades, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2031; andy.georgiades@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 13:57 ET (17:57 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : NTT DoCoMo,FamilyMart Agree On Capital Tie-Up
Story: The following is a press release from NTT DoCoMo:     TOKYO, JAPAN, May 28, 2007 --- FamilyMart Co., Ltd. and NTT DoCoMo, Inc. announced today that they will form a strategic alliance through a capital tie-up in which DoCoMo will acquire 2,930,500 shares of common stock owned by FamilyMart as treasury stock -- approximately 3% of total issued shares -- for about 9 billion yen on June 13, 2007.   From July 10, FamilyMart convenience stores nationwide will begin accepting mobile credit via DoCoMo's iD platform, thereby enabling users to make payments simply by waving their phones over a reader/writer. Currently, the iD platform is accepted in about 140 FamilyMart stores in Tokyo, Nagoya and Fukuoka cities.   The two companies expect to leverage mutually beneficial strengths, including FamilyMart's nationwide network of approximately 7,000 convenience stores and expertise in retail store operations, and DoCoMo's some 52 million customers and expertise in Osaifu-Keitai wallet services, as well as mobile credit services via the iD platform. These strengths, as well as the two companies' powerful brands, will foster value-added services that offer customers increased convenience and flexibility.   Initially, FamilyMart will upgrade reader/writers at FamilyMart payment counters for compatibility with DoCoMo's ToruCa information-capture service, thereby enabling customers to download coupons and useful information into their DoCoMo phones. In addition, Osaifu-Keitai compatible reader/writers will be installed in "Famiport" multimedia terminals in all FamilyMart stores. These services will become available by the end of May 2008.     The strategic alliance will be enhanced in other ways as well, including:     -Introduction of iD mobile payments for purchases made on FamilyMart's shopping website (http://www.famima.com/).   -Introduction of the "Famima iD" mobile credit card for "Famima Card" credit-card users. (FamilyMart currently offers credit and non-credit [points and other benefits only versions of the Famima Card, numbering 1.67 million cardholders as of April 2007.)   -Provision of benefits for using DoCoMo's DCMX and FamilyMart's "Famima iD" mobile credit cards via the iD platform at FamilyMart stores.   -Trial use of Famima Cards by owners of DoCoMo phones with Osaifu-Keitai capability.     Going forward, the two companies will consider other options, including:   -Incorporation of Osaifu-Keitai services in FamilyMart's customer relationship management (CRM) operations.   -Test marketing of other mobile-related services at selected FamilyMart stores.   -Exchanges of personnel to further develop value-added mobile-related services at FamilyMart stores.     About FamilyMart   FamilyMart centered on its core business of operating convenience stores through a network of more than 13,000 stores in Japan, Taiwan, Korea, Thailand, China and the United States of America, engaging in retailing business that provides more than 10 million customers everyday with high-value-added merchandise garnished with sincerity and hospitality. FamilyMart's business policy is to conduct convenience store operations in a way that enables customers, franchisees, business partners, and employees to interact harmoniously, and also to be an innovative corporate group that is the most advanced in its industry. FamilyMart is listed on the Tokyo stock exchange (8028).   For more information, visit www.family.co.jp/english   About NTT DoCoMo NTT DoCoMo is the world's leading mobile communications company. DoCoMo serves more than 52 million customers, including 36 million people subscribing to FOMA, launched as the world's first 3G mobile service based on W-CDMA in 2001. DoCoMo also offers a wide variety of leading-edge mobile multimedia services, including i-mode, the world's most popular mobile e-mail/Internet service, used by more than 47 million people. With the addition of credit-card and other e-wallet functions, DoCoMo mobile phones have become highly versatile tools for daily life. NTT DoCoMo is listed on the Tokyo (9437), London (NDCM) and New York (DCM) stock exchanges. For more information, visit www.nttdocomo.com.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 03:04 ET (07:04 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE:Australia Toll Investors Vote To Spin Off Rail, Ports
Story: MELBOURNE (Dow Jones)--Toll Holdings Ltd. (TOL.AU) shareholders Monday voted to spin off the rail and ports assets of Australia's largest transport company into a separate company - Asciano Ltd. (AXX.AU).   Under the plan, the company's investors will keep their existing shares and receive a stapled security made up of one new share and one new unit in Asciano for each share they own in Toll.   Toll chief executive Paul Little said the arrangement would give the Melbourne-based company access to key infrastructure without the need to own it, thereby satisfying competition regulations, and allow it to raise as much as an additional A$1 billion in debt for acquisitions.   "This gives us a lot of capacity on our balance sheet," Little said. "This restructure will allow both the Asciano business and our business to grow more aggressively."   Chairman John Moule told the meeting in Melbourne that Toll received sufficient proxy votes from investors to support the spin-off plan, with 384.9 million shares in favor and 717,920 against.   The decision, which will be announced later Monday, needs approval from 75% of shareholders present at the meeting to succeed.   Toll acquired the ports business, a 62% stake in Virgin Blue Holdings Ltd. (VBA.AU), Australia's second-largest airline, and full control of the Pacific National rail business, in which Toll previously had a half stake, from its A$6 billion acquisition of Patrick Corp. last year.   Toll needed to spin off Asciano because the need to invest capital in the rail and ports assets restricted the company's acquisition plans and raised antitrust concerns, Little told reporters.   "Toll previously had achieved a 20% pretax return on capital," he said.   "To be going down to a sub-10% return was something we felt our shareholders weren't overly excited about, and we needed to address that problem and this was the best outcome," Little said.   He told the meeting that after the spin-off Toll would remain one of Asia's leading providers of integrated logistics services.   "With Asian logistics markets expected to grow at rates of up to 25% per year, expansion of Toll Asia is a key platform for the development of the Toll business," Little said.   Toll will announce later this week it has bought an equity stake in Hong Kong-based Cargo Services, Little told reporters after the meeting.   The acquisition of the stake in the privately held freight forwarding company will help Toll expand its logistics business in and out of China, he said.   Cargo Services' largest Australian customer is Woolworths Ltd. (WOW.AU), Little said.   He declined to say how large the equity stake was.   Toll will also announce in a few weeks a joint venture with Virgin Blue, in which the company will have exclusive use of "belly space" in Virgin's aircraft to help Toll expand its international logistics business, Little said.   "And over and above that, Toll has recently commissioned three of its own purpose-designed 737 air freighters and we are now running them around Australia," he said.   "The specialized Toll freighters plus the Virgin Blue 'belly space' collectively will give us a wonderful platform for our air freight business," Little said.   Asciano is seeking to acquire bulk rail assets in Queensland and Western Australia states and to participate in ports expansion, chief executive Mark Rowsthorn told reporters after the meeting.   The company wants to gain customers in Queensland to carry coal and agricultural commodities in Western Australia, he said.   Rowsthorn is comfortable with Asciano's A$6 billion net debt, which is "comparable with our peers in infrastructure and arguably we could push the gearing harder if we chose to do that."   The company had a gearing of about 60%, which will rise to 67% in the company's first three years as it invests in expanding its Brisbane ports assets and its national rail network, he said.   Asciano also has joined a consortium that is bidding to build and operate a 2,600-kilometer railroad in Saudi Arabia to carry freight, he said.   If court approval is gained, shares in Asciano will trading on June 6.   At 0440 GMT, shares in Toll were down 1.3% at A$22.07, compared with the broader market's 0.2% decline.     -By Andrew Harrison, Dow Jones Newswires; 61-3-9671-4323; andrew.harrison@dowjones.com   -Edited by Paul Godby     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 00:53 ET (04:53 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Venezuela's Mining Law Ready For Chavez In 2 Weeks - Minister
Story: CARACAS (Dow Jones)--Venezuela's mining ministry plans to turn over a new mining law to President Hugo Chavez for approval in two weeks, a minister said Monday.   "In two weeks we will turn (the mining law) over to the president. We're putting the final touches on it based on three proposals we have on hand," Mining Minister Jose Khan told Dow Jones Newswires in a telephone interview.   A fully pro-Chavez congress unanimously gave the president special presidential powers early in the year so he can create laws for a year and a half without consulting congress.   Under the new mining law, Khan said the figure of the mining concession will end because it has a history of giving holders "a sense that they own the resources."   Khan acknowledged that the new law could follow in the footsteps of state oil company Petroleos de Venezuela, PdVSA, which converted oil deals into a mixed company framework.   "There is a proposal which PdVSA has used to transform oil deals into mixed companies," with the state in control, Khan said. But the minister could not say if this will apply to active mine concessions and contracts as well as those deemed unproductive.   Khan said the public "will have to wait for the law to come out" to see any specifics.   On the issue of the Las Cristinas gold mine, controlled by Canadian company Crystallex International Corp. (KRY), he said no decision has been made yet on how the law will apply in that case. Unlike other mines in the country, Crystallex holds an operating contract but has yet to receive a needed environmental permit to begin operations.   Khan indicated that even though the environmental permit is still pending, some additional permits are on the way. "I understand that (the environment ministry is) giving a permit but it's for expanding roads and to build walkways and those types of works" at the mine, he said.   The Chavez government has lately launched a two-phase review of all mining company operations in Venezuela and is paying particular attention to those projects related to gold and diamonds. All companies are expected to present details of their operations to the government for close inspection. Foreign companies operating in Venezuela include the U.S. Hecla Mining Co. (HL), and Gold Reserve Inc., among others.   Chavez has vowed to create the equivalent of a PdVSA for gold and diamonds that would oversee deals in those sectors. The president's latest campaign to nationalize strategic assets has led many to believe he could force a stronger state role on the mining industry.     -By Raul Gallegos; Dow Jones Newswires; +58-212-564-1339; raul.gallegos@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 15:52 ET (19:52 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Ascendant Copper Announces Drill Results From Chaucha Copper-Moly Project, Ecuador>ACX.T
Story: DENVER, COLORADO--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - Ascendant Copper Corporation (the "Company"), (TSX:ACX)(TSX:ACX.WT)(BERLIN:A0HMLE)(FRANKFURT:A5C)(WKN:A0HMLE), announced today the results from its first core drilling program on its Chaucha copper-molybdenum property, 75 kilometers southeast of Guayaquil, Ecuador. To date, a 10-hole, 3,174 meter program has been completed in the Naranjos mineralized sector of the project area (see Figure 2) that has preliminarily defined a supergene enrichment zone underlying the Naranjos mineralized sector about 40 meters thick. Copper equivalent values in this enrichment zone exceed 0.50%. In addition the drilling has begun to define what appears to be a large copper porphyry system underlying the Naranjos mineralized sector of the Chaucha concession (see Figure 2).    At the Naranjos mineralized sector three core holes were drilled into a previously inferred copper-molybdenum resource. Hole NA-03 encountered a 112 meters grading 0.54% copper and 0.029% molybdenum. Hole NA-02 reported 104 meters of 0.41% copper and 0.023% molybdenum. Hole NA-01 had 42 meters at the bottom of the hole that averaged 0.40% copper and 0.015% molybdenum. True thickness is estimated to be equal to drilled thickness as the mineralized zone encountered is determined to be flat-lying.    Seven additional core holes (NA-04 through NA-10) were drilled over a horizontal distance of 1,200 meters to the east of the Naranjos mineralized sector. All holes showed copper and molybdenum mineralization. The results are summarized in the table (Figure 1) below.    A nine hole core drilling program has recently been completed on the Gur Gur mineralized sector of the Chaucha property, Assay results have not been received for all the holes completed and results will be made public when all assay results have been received. Drilling will next test soil geochemical anomalies and structural targets west of the main Naranjos mineralized sector in the area called Loma de Tunas.    John R. King, the Company's resident exploration and geological expert as well as a Qualified Person as defined by National Instrument 43-101, Standards of Disclosure for Mineral Projects ("NI43-101"), has reviewed the above statements and assay results. Mr. King confirms that quality controls and correct assay procedures were followed by the Company and these geologic observations of the samples are correct. Assaying of the samples was conducted by ALS Chemex Laboratories, an ISO certified laboratory in Santiago, Chile and Acme Labs, an ISO certified laboratory in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.    Nine exploration campaigns have been conducted on the Chaucha property since 1970 by entities like Billiton, Armeno, OMRD, Carlos Puig & Associates SA, among others. Including Ascendant's recent drilling, more than 17,000 meters of drilling have been completed and 132 holes analyzed. The nine campaigners also completed more than 568 meters of underground exploration drifting which was analyzed every two meters and provided bulk samples for metallurgical testing.    Ascendant Copper Corporation is a mineral exploration and development company responsibly advancing its Chaucha and Junin copper-molybdenum projects in Ecuador toward a verifiable economic base metal discovery. Ascendant has a solid asset base, proven management, and is committed to becoming a mid-tier copper producer through its agreement in respect of the Chaucha project with Antofagasta PLC (LSE:ANTO) and its strategic exploration alliance with Rio Tinto (LSE:RTZ) in Ecuador. Headline: : Silverwing Energy Inc. Announces Equity Financing And Tomahawk Project Restructuring>SVW.T
Story: CALGARY, May 28 /CNW/ - Silverwing Energy Inc. ("Silverwing" or the "Corporation") (TSX:SVW) is pleased to announce that it has concluded its previously disclosed value maximization process and has entered into agreements to obtain a 50% partner on its current Tomahawk area farmin project in central Alberta (the "Tomahawk Farmin"), to extend its drilling deadlines pursuant to the Tomahawk Farmin and to pursue an equity offering to raise funds to finance its development and exploration program and reduce its working capital deficiency.    Tomahawk Partnership    Silverwing has entered into a participation agreement (the "Participation Agreement") with Argen Energy Corp. ("Argen"), a private oil & gas exploration and development company with offices in Buenos Aires, Argentina and Toronto, Canada for the participation by Argen in the farmin agreement dated May 1, 2006 among Canadian Natural Resources Limited ("CNRL") and Imperial Oil Resources ("IOR"), as farmors, and Silverwing, as farmee (the "Farmin Agreement"). Pursuant to the Participation Agreement, Argen has agreed to pay 50% of the costs arising under the agreement in order to earn 50% of Silverwing's earned interest under the agreement. The Agreement also includes a requirement for Argen to equalize all payments made to date under the Farmin Agreement by Silverwing.    Tomahawk Farmin Extension    Silverwing has also entered into a letter agreement with CNRL and IOR whereby CNRL and IOR have agreed to extend the initial drilling commitment under the Tomahawk Farmin to December 31, 2007. The Tomahawk Farmin requires the Corporation to drill 29 wells in the initial phase, with an option to earn additional land with more drilling commitments. On an individual well payout basis, Silverwing must pay 100% of the costs to earn a 60% working interest in the leases after payout with an average earning of two sections per well. The extension is conditional upon (a) Silverwing entering into commitment letter with a 50% joint venture partner for the completion of the initial drilling program under the Tomahawk Farmin, (b) Silverwing providing a signed commitment letter from the Agents (as defined below) for the raising of such capital as is necessary to complete the initial drilling program under the Tomahawk Farmin; (c) the payment by Silverwing to CNRL and IOR of an aggregate $500,000 on or before May 31, 2007 in consideration of the Farmin Agreement extension; and (d) the payment by Silverwing to CNRL and IOR of an aggregate $11,100,000 to an escrow account on or before May 31, 2007 (the "Escrow Funds"). The Escrow Funds can be drawn down on a pro-rata basis as Silverwing meets the drilling commitments under the Farmin Agreement.    In addition to the above, Argen is in process of negotiating the acquisition of: (1) a 50% interest in 2,180 boepd in Argentina at a cost of approximately $20 million USD; (2) a farmin on 2 different exploitation and exploration prospects in the Provinces of Neuquen and Santa Cruz, Argentina totalling $50 million USD of drilling and completion costs.    Management of Silverwing and Argen anticipate that, following the completion of the drilling program of 29 wells under the Tomahawk Farmin Agreement, Silverwing and Argen will discuss effecting a business combination on a net asset value to net asset value basis.    Credit Facility    In order to obtain the funds necessary to complete the Escrow Funds condition under the Farmin Agreement extension letter prior to the condition date, Quest Capital Corp. ("Quest") has entered into a term sheet with Silverwing to provide a secured credit facility in the principal amount of $12 million (the "Loan"), to be placed into an escrow account for the discharge of Silverwing's commitments under the Tomahawk Farmin Agreement, projected for closing on or before May 31, 2007. The Loan will be due and payable on or before November 30, 2007 with no penalty for pre-payment. The interest payable on the Loan is 12% per annum, compounded monthly. In addition, the term sheet calls for Silverwing to issue, subject to Toronto Stock Exchange (the "TSX") approval, 3,400,000 Silverwing shares to Quest at a deemed price of $0.30 as a standby fee and non-refundable bonus payment (being 10.1% of the currently issued and outstanding common shares of Silverwing). The Loan contemplates security as a second charge against the Corporation's domestic assets and by general security agreement against all of the Corporation's present and after-acquired personal property. It is intended that the Loan will be repaid from the proceeds of the Equity Offering (as defined below). Following the closing of the Loan, Quest will, by virtue of the standby fee and non-refundable bonus payment, be the holder of 9.1% of the issued and outstanding common shares of Silverwing.    Pursuant to the term sheet, the material conditions precedent to completion of the Loan are (i) regulatory and TSX approval, (ii) approval by the board of directors of Quest, (iii) completion of due diligence, (iv) the Farmin Agreement being in good standing, and (v) the Corporation's primary credit facility with National Bank remaining less than $15 million.    Proposed Equity Offering    Silverwing has engaged Fraser Mackenzie Limited ("FML") and Jacob & Company Securities Inc. ("JCS") (collectively, the "Agents"), both of Toronto, to act as exclusive agents for the public offering of units on a marketed best-efforts basis to raise gross proceeds of a minimum of $25 million (the "Equity Offering"). The minimum offering will be the sale of 83,333,333 units with each unit (a "Unit") consisting of one Silverwing common share (a "Common Share") and one purchase warrant (a "Warrant") at a price of Cdn $0.30 per Unit. Each Warrant will be exercisable into one Common Share at a price of $0.40 per Common Share for a period for 18 months following the closing of the Equity Offering. The Agents also have on option (the "Over-allotment Option") to place up to an additional $5 million of Units (16,666,666 Units) for a maximum total offering of $30 million.    For their services in connection with the Equity Offering, the Agents will receive a cash commission equal to 7% of the aggregate proceeds of the Equity Offering and warrants (the "Agent's Compensation Warrants") to purchase a number of Common Shares equal to 3.5% of the number of Units sold in the Equity Offering. Each Agent's Compensation Warrant will entitle the Agents to purchase one Common Share at a price of $0.30 per Common Share for a period of 18 months from the closing of the Equity Offering.    Following closing of the Loan, and if the maximum Equity Offering (including the Over-allotment Option) is fully subscribed, a total of 206,900,000 new Common Shares will be issued or issuable through the Loan and the Equity Offering (also taking into account the exercise of the Warrants and the Agent's Compensation Warrants), representing approximately 611% of Silverwing's issued and outstanding common shares. Depending upon the make-up of the placees under the Equity Offering, the closing of the Loan and Equity Offering may materially affect control of Silverwing. There is currently no participation in the Equity Offering currently contemplated by insiders of Silverwing.    The Equity Offering is targeted for closing during or about the week of June 18, 2007. The Corporation intends to use the proceeds of the Equity Offering, net of the fees and expenses of the Equity Offering, to pursue its development and exploration program in the Tomahawk area of Alberta and to reduce its working capital deficiency.    Pursuant to the private placement rules in the TSX Company Manual, the issuance of greater than 25% of the issued and outstanding shares of an issuer at a discount to market, as contemplated pursuant to the Equity Offering, and a potential material affect on the control of an issuer generally requires shareholder approval prior to completion. Silverwing has obtained an exemption from the TSX from the requirement to seek shareholder approval pursuant to Section 604(e) of the TSX Company Manual on the basis of financial hardship.    Recommendation of Silverwing's Special Committee    A special committee of the Board of Directors of Silverwing (the "Board") composed of Drew Tumbach, Robert Wagemakers and Geoff Waterman, each of whom is free from any interest in the Equity Offering or the Loan and is unrelated to any of the parties involved in the Equity Offering or the Loan, recommended that the Corporation proceed with the Equity Offering and the Loan and that, as a result of the deadline to deposit the Escrow Funds by May 31, 2007, Silverwing make an application to the TSX for an exemption from the requirement to seek shareholder approval on a determination of financial hardship. Based on this recommendation, the Board has determined that Silverwing is currently in serious financial difficulty, that the offering is designed to improve its financial position and that is reasonable in the circumstances, and has approved the Equity Offering and the Loan.    Upon completion of the Equity Offering and the Loan, the Corporation will no longer be in default under its principal debt facility.    This news release shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of any offer to buy, nor shall there be any sale of these securities in any jurisdiction in which such offer, solicitation or sale would be unlawful. The securities offered have not been and will not be registered under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and may not be offered or sold in the United States absent registration or applicable exemption from the registration requirements of the U.S. Securities Act and applicable state securities laws.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 16:58 ET (20:58 GMT)

Headline: : Virtek Vision Webcast Annual Meeting, Tuesday, May 29 At 4 P.M. (ET)>VRK.T
Story: WATERLOO, ON, May 28 /CNW/ - Virtek Vision International Inc. (TSX: VRK), a leading developer and provider of high-value industrial laser solutions, today announced that it will provide a live audio webcast of its Annual Meeting at 4:00 p.m. ET on Tuesday, May 29, 2007. Shareholders and interested investors are invited to attend the meeting in person at the Intercontinental Toronto Centre, Kingsway Room, 225 Front Street West, Toronto.    The live audio webcast will be available at www.newswire.ca and www.virtek.ca.    About Virtek    Virtek Vision International Inc. is a leading developer and provider of high-value industrial laser solutions focused on the needs of the global manufacturing sector providing templating, inspection, marking and engraving products and systems integration solutions. Virtek serves customers in the prefabricated construction, transportation, metalworking, tool and die, and mold making industries worldwide. Virtek is a full-service provider with services including research and development, manufacturing, integration, training, after-sales support, and installation. The company provides high value for its customers, feature-rich systems with a quick pay-back, productivity enhancements, and total turnkey solutions. Based in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada, Virtek also has offices in Boston, Massachusetts, USA; Ludenscheid and Nurnberg, Germany; and Busto Arsizio, Italy. Please visit www.virtek.ca for more information.             /CONTACT: Peter Monsberger, VP Finance and CFO, (519) 746-7190, (519) 746-3383 (FAX), Email: peter.monsberger@virtek.ca, or Bob Sandness, President and CEO, (519) 746-7190, (519) 746-3383 (FAX), Email: bob.sandness@virtek.ca, or Investor and Media Relations: Richard Wertheim, Managing Partner, Wertheim + Company Inc., (416) 594-1600 (Bus.), (416) 518-8479 (Cell), Email: wertheim@wertheim.ca     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 09:58 ET (13:58 GMT)

Headline: Opawica Expl To Make C$700,000 Pvt Placement >OPW.T
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Opawica Explorations Inc. (OPW.T) has settled the terms of a private placement, option and joint-venture agreement with Northgate Minerals Corp. (NXG).   Opawica said Northgate has agreed to subscribe for 10 million shares of Opawica at 7 Canadian cents each in a private placement for proceeds to Opawica of C$700,000. This placement represents about 9% of Opawica's outstanding common shares.   Northgate and Opawica have agreed to an option and joint-venture agreement whereby Northgate may earn up to a 55% interest in all of the mineral rights to Opawica's Matachewan, Ont., properties and a 100% interest in surface access, easement and/or rights on at least 14 Opawica claims out of the 66 claims presently owned or under option by Opawica in the Matachewan area.   -Tara Zachariah; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 16:28 ET (20:28 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Frontera Copper Executive Appointments>FCC.T
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 05/28/07 --    (All dollar amounts are expressed in United States currency unless otherwise noted)   Frontera Copper Corporation (TSX: FCC)(TSX: FCC.NT)(TSX: FCC.NT.A) is pleased to announce two executive appointments at Cobre del Mayo, S.A. de C.V., (CDM), Frontera Copper's wholly owned Mexican subsidiary.   Effective June 1, Jesus Gutierrez B. will assume the newly created position of Director General of Cobre del Mayo, S.A. de C.V. Since joining CDM as Director de Operaciones on June 30, 2005, Jesus has staffed and led the organization from feasibility through start up and into production in near record time and with no significant upsets. Jesus Gutierrez came to Frontera Copper with a technical background rich in mining and processing operations and management. He has held positions of varying responsibility, including Director de Operaciones for Grupo Mexico's Cananea operations, Director General of Minera Real de Angeles and Director General de Empresas Frisco. In his new role as Director General, he will be responsible for all CDM operations and business matters and will report directly to Gary Loving, President and CEO of Frontera Copper.   The company is also very pleased to welcome Joseph P. Campbell to the position of Director de Operaciones for Cobre del Mayo. Joe Campbell has over twenty-four years of experience in management, supervisory and engineering roles with Inmet Mining Company, Phelps Dodge Mining Company (a subsidiary of Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold Inc.), Cyprus Minerals, Cyprus Amax and Cleveland Cliffs. Most recently Joe was Director Processing of Inmet Mining Company's Cobre Las Cruces, S.A. Project, in Spain. Previously he worked at Phelps Dodge and Cyprus Minerals properties located in Arizona and Peru. Joe has co-authored several technical papers dealing with copper leaching and electrowinning processes and has been a leader of the changes and improvements incorporated at the Cerro Verde Operation in Arequipa, Peru. Joe holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Metallurgical Engineering from the University of Minnesota and is a member of the SME/AIME and the Instituto de Ingenieros de Minas del Peru.   "With Piedras Verdes now operating at full production, our attention is focused on improving our operating efficiencies," says Gary Loving, President and CEO Frontera Copper. We continue to strengthen our operating team, which will enable us to improve the operating cost performance at Piedras Verdes and also to provide Frontera Copper with the ability to evaluate and develop additional projects. With the quality and depth of talent that we are fortunate to have at Frontera Copper and Cobre del Mayo, I believe that we are uniquely positioned to develop new additional projects, and utilize the significant cash flows which are expected to be generated from the Piedras Verdes operations."   Annual General Meeting   Frontera Copper will hold the Annual General Meeting on June 27, 2007 at 3:00 p.m. The meeting will be held in Toronto at The Dominion Club "Melinda Gallery," One King Street West.   About Frontera Copper   Frontera Copper is a Canadian mining, development and exploration company whose principal activity is the production of copper cathode from the Piedras Verdes run-of-mine heap-leach copper operation in Sonora, Mexico. Production commenced in October, 2006.and has ramped up to an annual rate of 70 million pounds. A total of 942 million pounds of copper is projected to be produced during the 18-year life of the operation. Existing resources and prospective exploration targets adjacent to the main open-pit have the potential to extend the life of the project.   The Company currently anticipates production of 60 to 63 million pounds of "LME Grade A" quality copper cathode during 2007 at a cash cost of approximately $1.19 to $1.27 per pound (including prepaid royalties). Capital expenditures for 2007 are forecast at $30 million.   Information in this news release that is not current or historical factual information may constitute forward-looking information or statements within the meaning of applicable securities laws. Implicit in this information, particularly in respect of statements as to future operating results and economic performance of the Company, and resources and reserves at the Piedras Verdes operations, are assumptions regarding projected revenue and expense, copper prices and mining costs. These assumptions, although considered reasonable by the Company at the time of preparation, may prove to be incorrect. Readers are cautioned that actual results are subject to a number of risks and uncertainties, including risks relating to general economic conditions and mining operations, and could differ materially from what is currently expected. The Company disclaims any intention or obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise.      Contacts: Frontera Copper Corporation Ann Gibbs Manager of Investor Relations (416) 350-5132 or Toll Free: 1-888-323-0973 Email: ann@fronteracopper.com Frontera Copper Corporation Dave Peat Chief Financial Officer (602) 667-3202 Email: dave.peat@fronteracopper.com Website: www.fronteracopper.com     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 10:06 ET (14:06 GMT)

Headline: THE SKEPTIC: Counting On Fortis
Story: By Matthew Curtin     A DOW JONES NEWSWIRES COLUMN     PARIS (Dow Jones)--From the moment Barclays bid for ABN Amro, the major problem the British bank faced was a counter-offer from one of several rivals better placed to extract value out of the Dutch bank.   Now Barclays' pre-emptive sale of the Dutch bank's LaSalle unit to Bank of America has so legally entangled ABN Amro's future that the Royal Bank of Scotland-led consortium might yet find it impossible to top Barclays.   RBS and partners are scheduled to update the Dutch authorities on their plans Tuesday. That could include details of a formal bid assuming something comes of the intense recent talks RBS has held with BoA over LaSalle.   If it does, it's the presence of Fortis in the RBS consortium and its potential merger synergies with ABN that may tip the balance in favor of their offer over Barclays.'   After all, if there is a model about how European banks should go about adapting to falling intra-European trade barriers, globalization and competing with bigger U.S. rivals, it's based on bulking up at home to be better able to expand abroad.   Europe's biggest, most prosperous banks have done exactly that - unlike ABN Amro - whether it's RBS and HSBC or Santander, BNP Paribas and Unicredit.   They've shown merger-related cost cutting and maximizing your domestic footprint to push more higher-margin products to more customers -  within the boundary of anti-trust concerns that aren't seen as significant in the Fortis-ABN case - is vital for generating better returns from the lower-growth banking markets of Europe's richest economies.   It's true that after rebuffed merger overture to banks like Dexia and KBC, Fortis gave up on Benelux consolidation, committing itself to diversifying abroad so that its home market contributed no more than 30% of net profit by 2009.   Given that has a ring of ABN Amro's failed strategy, Fortis shareholders mightn't be that sad to see a return to home truths.   Indeed, few people reckoned ABN Amro's Benelux assets would be up for sale in circumstances where Fortis' superior management - judging by most performance ratios - is well placed to call the shots in any future combination. Fortis could hardly pass up on the opportunity.   Fortis' relatively low retail-banking profile in the Netherlands, and the likelihood RBS will have dibs on much of ABN Amro's European corporate-banking business, does suggest cost-saving by eliminating overlap won't be huge.   But the savings are bigger than any Barclays can reasonably expect from the Benelux, quite apart from the potential for longer-term revenue gains Fortis can expect if it picks up ABN Amro's asset-management, private-client, and Asian operations.   As for the financing, using Fortis' shares, trading at a discount to many of its peers' and ABN Amro's , as an acquisition currency is a cheap way to finance a EUR27-billion contribution to the consortium's bid.   If Fortis funds around a fifth of that with debt, and considering the excess capital it has at its disposal, that would leave its capital ratios in line with its objectives and make the acquisition earnings enhancing in 2008, according to analysis by Keefe, Bruyette & Woods.   With that financial and strategic logic underpinning Fortis' involvement in the RBS consortium, ABN Amro shareholders may well yet have a sweet offer on the table alongside Barclays'.     (Matthew Curtin has been a financial news reporter since 1990, and has reported on international finance and business for Dow Jones Newswires - from South Africa, Singapore and now Paris - since 1994. He can be reached at +331 4017 1746 or by e-mail: matthew.curtin@dowjones.com)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 07:55 ET (11:55 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Sanyo Swings To Operating Profit Last FY
Story: (Adds background, quotes.)     TOKYO (Dow Jones)--Japan's Sanyo Electric Co. (6764.TO) said Monday its restructuring efforts were beginning to bear fruit, as it swung into the black on an operating basis last fiscal year and forecast a net profit for the current year.   The Osaka-based electronics maker booked a Y49.57 billion group operating profit in the year ended March, compared with a Y17.15 billion operating loss the previous year.   Sanyo is in the midst of a major restructuring that has included job cuts, factory closings and exits from unprofitable businesses. Last year the company received a Y300 billion bailout from Goldman Sachs and other investors.   Its efforts have been overshadowed by resignations of top executives, faulty accounting that led to the restatement of past results and product recalls.   But Sanyo President Seiichiro Sano said Monday his focus was on the company's bottom line.   "The major theme for this fiscal year is to achieve a net profit on a consolidated and parent basis," he said.   "We had an operating profit last fiscal year through our restructuring efforts. This restructuring will continue unabated."   Sanyo said its group net loss improved to Y45.36 billion versus a Y205.66 billion loss a year earlier, even as its group sales fell 7.6% to Y2.215 trillion from Y2.397 trillion.   Sanyo's restructuring efforts were most apparent in its electronic component division, where it shot up to a Y18.33 billion operating profit from a Y28.55 billion operating loss a year ago. The company said one factor was its semiconductor operations, which climbed into the black during the period.   Industry observers and people close the matter say Sanyo is currently seeking a buyer for its semiconductor operations.   The company said its net losses continued because it booked the cost of reorganizing its digital camera business, increasing overseas production of its mobile phone handsets and cutting its global payroll.   While that marked a strong improvement, Sano said its mobile phone and digital camera operations still faced "very harsh" conditions and would be a major focus for the company as it strove to retain profitability.   For the current fiscal year, the company forecasts a group net profit of Y20 billion on revenue of Y2.230 trillion.   Sano assumed leadership of the company last month after Toshimasa Iue, whose grandfather founded the company, stepped down. Iue cited difficulties in working with major investors such as Goldman as reasons for his departure.   A Goldman spokesman said the company had no comment on Sanyo's earnings or current financial condition.   Sanyo Electric's earnings are based on U.S. accounting standards.     -By Jay Alabaster and Hiroyuki Kachi, Dow Jones Newswires; 813-5255-2929; jay.alabaster@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 05:33 ET (09:33 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Cdn Pacific Rail Plans For Potential Oil-Sands Boom
Story: By Monica Gutschi     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     TORONTO (Dow Jones)--With an eye to the huge potential from Alberta's oil-sands development, Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd. (CP) plans to build the first new rail subdivision in its network in more than 30 years to serve a cluster of proposed refineries.   "We see significant opportunity for growth," said Ray Foot, the railroad's vice-president of merchandise marketing and sales.   Canadian Pacific said it has applied for regulatory approval to construct rail lines along 16 miles of right-of-way in Sturgeon and Strathcona counties just northeast of Edmonton.   Companies such as Petro-Canada (PCZ), France's Total S.A. (TOT), and Holland's Royal Dutch Shell PLC (RDSA) have plans to build, or are building bitumen upgraders in the area. As well, there are other oil-sands and energy-related developments underway near the small town of Fort Saskatchewan on the North Saskatchewan River.   Alberta's oil sands have proven reserves of 174 billion barrels, second only to Saudi Arabia. Oil-sands production was 1.1 million barrels a day in 2005 and is forecast to be nearly triple that amount by 2015.   Although he refused to speculate on total potential volumes, Foot noted that rails carry most of the byproducts created in the production of refined oil from the bitumen extracted from the oil sands - such as sulphur, petroleum coke, and asphaltene.   Foot also said there is growing demand for rail service to bring in the construction materials such as steel and cement for the proposed developments.   "In addition to that long-term business that we anticipate, we are very excited about the short-term opportunities to move in construction materials," Foot said.   Canadian Pacific plans to spend C$15 million immediately to improve its logistics and distribution capabilities in the area.   The remainder of the project would be built in stages in conjunction with the construction of the bitumen upgraders. Foot said he expected it would take about two years to obtain all the regulatory and environmental approvals necessary to begin building the rail lines, as well as the planned logistics centers, marshalling yards and rail bridge crossing the North Saskatchewan river   "At this point in time, the upgraders have been announced," Foot said. "Our actual construction will be done in lockstep with the upgraders moving forward, and the volumes related to those."   The total cost of the project would depend on the eventual size of the rail line, he said. But given the time frames needed for the approval process and initial construction, he said the railroad has taken the first step of amassing the land necessary and seeking approval from the Canadian Transportation Agency.   Company Web Site: http://www.cpr.ca     -Monica Gutschi, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2017; monica.gutschi@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 13:29 ET (17:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : International Datacasting Announces Shareholder Intent To Sell Stock>IDC.T
Story: OTTAWA, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - International Datacasting Corporation (TSX:IDC) announced today that it has been advised that one of its shareholders, Magito B.V. (a private holding company located in the Netherlands), intends to offer for sale up to approximately 2,671,000 Common Shares of IDC over the next fifteen days.    Magito B.V. is a former shareholder of PROFline B.V. which was acquired by IDC in November 2005.  The Common Shares that Magito B.V. has indicated it intends to offer for sale constitute approximately 6.1% of IDC's outstanding shares and were all issued by IDC in connection with its acquisition of PROFline B.V.  IDC is advised that Magito B.V. intends to initially offer its IDC shares at a price of Cdn.$0.80 although this price may be altered depending on the level of interest.    IDC is further advised that the sale is being proposed for personal reasons of Magito B.V.'s principal shareholder.  There is no assurance that any sale of shares will be completed by Magito B.V.  Magito B.V. is not an insider of IDC. To IDC's knowledge, the shares to be offered for sale constitute substantially all of Magito B.V.'s holdings in IDC.    Ron Clifton, IDC's President and Chief Executive Officer, stated, "although we do not think that any sale of Magito's interest in IDC will necessarily have an impact on our share price, in the interest of full disclosure, we wanted to make sure that investors were aware that a large volume trade or series of trades in our shares may occur over the next fifteen days".    About International Datacasting Corporation (IDC):    IDC (TSX:IDC) provides advanced products, systems and services for the implementation of broadband wireless infrastructure networks used to distribute broadband multimedia data. IDC is at the forefront of delivering IP-based datacasting solutions via satellite and content distribution technologies with installations in more than 100 countries worldwide. IDC's products are in demand for radio and television broadcast networks, enterprise networks, distance learning, digital signage and digital cinema, high-speed Internet infrastructure and other multimedia content distribution applications. IDC is a recipient of numerous awards including the prestigious Canada Export Award for Innovation and Technology Achievement. IDC is headquartered in Ottawa, Canada, operates in Europe through its wholly owned subsidiary PROFline B.V. in Arnhem, the Netherlands and has an established international network of value-added partners and distributors. Visit IDC on the web at www.intldata.ca and www.profline.com .    This press release contains forward-looking statements that may involve risks and uncertainties. Actual results may differ materially. Factors that might cause a difference include, but are not limited to, competitive developments, risks associated with IDC's growth, the development of the satellite datacasting market, regulatory risks, intellectual property infringement and other factors. IDC assumes no obligation to update these forward-looking statements to reflect events or circumstances after the date hereof. More detailed information about potential factors that could affect IDC's financial and business results is included in the public documents IDC files from time to time with Canadian securities regulatory authorities. Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Analysts Downplay Rio Tinto Interest In Alcan
Story: (Adds background, managing director comment, closing share price)       By Lyndal McFarland and Elisabeth Behrmann     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     SYDNEY (Dow Jones)--Rio Tinto (RTP) has emerged as a potential suitor for Canada's Alcan Inc.(AL) and is considering a US$27 billion-plus tilt according to Australian media reports, but analysts Monday played down the benefits of a linkup between the two global resource majors.   Rio Tinto has hired bankers from Deutsche Bank to advise it on a possible bid for Alcan, which last week rejected a US$27 billion bid from Alcoa Inc (AA) as too low, the Sydney Morning Herald reported, without citing sources.   Rio Tinto Managing Director Charlie Lenegan declined to comment on the report.   "We don't comment on those items," Lenegan told Dow Jones Newswires on the sidelines of an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation energy ministers meeting in Darwin. A Sydney-based Deutsche Bank spokeswoman also declined comment.   Alcan's board last week urged shareholders to reject Alcoa's hostile cash and shares offer on the grounds that it was too low and completion of the merger was too uncertain due to regulatory and other hurdles.   But Alcoa said last week it is sticking to its offer,  saying management has already met with a significant number of Alcan's shareholders and "are pleased to have received strong support for the combination."   Alcan has also not ruled out the option of buying Alcoa, in what's known as a Pac-Man strategy after the popular 1980's video game.   It has also said it is in talks with third parties about other options.   Along with Rio Tinto and BHP Billiton (BHP), the Sydney Morning Herald report said other interested parties could include Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (RIO), Anglo American Plc (AAUK), Xstrata Plc (XTA.LN), Rusal, Chinese groups and private equity groups.   The newspaper said BHP has progressed no further than other companies that have made a preliminary expression of interest. A BHP Billiton spokeswoman declined to comment. Last week, Canada's Globe and Mail newspaper said Alcan was in talks with BHP.   The report comes amid a wave of speculation surrounding consolidation in the booming resource sector.   Among the more high profile deals, nickel producer LionOre is at the center of a C$6.8 billion takeover battle between Xstrata and Russia's OAO Norilsk Nickel. Rio Tinto has also been the subject of takeover speculation over recent weeks, with BHP Billiton named by analysts at Citi as a potential suitor.   However, analysts downplayed the chances of a tilt by Rio Tinto or BHP Billiton for Alcan, pointing to limited synergies with the Canadian company's assets. They see a tie-up between Alcoa and Alcan as the most beneficial, and obvious, outcome.   "Rio certainly has done the numbers but that doesn't mean they'll bid," Global Mining Research analyst Tony Robson said.   "Rio is a value-driven company and you'd need an aluminum price of US$1-US$1.10/lb to justify a bid for Alcan on NPV (net present value) terms," he said, noting aluminum is now at US$1.27/lb - a level considered historically high.   "Question is, does Rio believe in such a high long-term price assumption?"   Robson also noted that Alcan's downstream packaging and engineered products divisions are a risk given low profit margins, which would likely further reduce synergies for the likes of Rio Tinto or any of the other names linked to the company.   "Alcoa has quoted synergies of US$1 billion but it's likely to be a lot less for other potential bidders like BHP Billiton or CVRD," Robson said.   Gavin Wendt, analyst at Sydney-based Fat Prophets, also played down the synergies between the likes of Rio Tinto and BHP Billiton with Alcan.   "Alcan surely is talking to other companies to find a white knight, but Alcoa is the main player," Wendt said.   Another analyst, who did not want to be identified, said a white knight bid for Alcan is likely to emerge more from elsewhere than Rio Tinto or BHP Billiton given what he sees as limited synergies.   The analyst believes Chinese resources companies or private equity groups could also take a close look at the Canadian aluminum producer.   However, analysts at global ratings agency Fitch said earlier this month, Aluminum Corp. Of China, the world's second largest alumina producer and fourth largest aluminum producer, is unlikely to bid alone for Alcan.   Fitch Ratings Asia Pacific Director Danny Chen said Chalco is not in a financial position to go it alone, while global synergies may be light.   Alcoa taking on Alcan would create the world's largest producer of the light-weight metal at 7.7 million metric tons, followed by Russia's United Company Rusal with 4 million tons.    Alcoa-Alcan's combined alumina output, a key raw material for aluminum production would come to 20.9 million tons.   United emerged this year from the three-way merger of Russian Aluminium, Sual and Swiss-based Glencore.   More than half of Alcan's assets are in North America with downstream capacity concentrated in Europe and bauxite and alumina operations in Asia, Australia and Africa.   Rio Tinto produced 844,700 tons of aluminum in 2006, and 16.4 million tons of alumina, with BHP at 1.36 million tons of aluminum and 4.19 million tons of alumina.    Rio Tinto shares closed up 1.5% at A$94.15 on the Austrlaian Stock Exchange. BHP Billiton was up 1.5% at A$31.13.       -By Lyndal McFarland, Dow Jones Newswires; 61-2-8235-2957;      lyndal.mcfarland@dowjones.com     -Edited by Paul Dekkers     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 02:38 ET (06:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: India Mahindra Exec:Hope To Close Punjab Tractors Buy By June
Story: MUMBAI (Dow Jones)--India's Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. (500520.BY) hopes to complete its purchase of a controlling stake in Punjab Tractors Ltd. (500344.BY) by June, a senior company official said Monday.   "The open offer (for a 43.3% stake in Punjab Tractors) has opened today and we hope the transaction will be over by end-June," said Mahindra's Finance President Bharat Doshi.   Mahindra President (Automotive Sector) Pawan Goenka also said the company is developing two new vehicle platforms with an investment of INR6 billion each.   "One platform will be a sports utility vehicle which will be slightly upmarket ... and the other product will be a mass market vehicle which can be used for both cargo and passengers," Goenka said, without giving a timeframe for launch.     -By Neelabh Chaturvedi, Dow Jones Newswires; +91-011-23074020; nitin.luthra@dowjones.com   -Edited by Alpana Sarma     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 06:39 ET (10:39 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Parkland Income Fund Announces Closing Of United Petroleum Products Acquisition>PKI.UN.T
Story: RED DEER, AB, May 28 /CNW/ - Parkland Income Fund ("Parkland" or the "Fund"- TSX: PKI.UN) has closed its previously announced acquisition of all of the shares of United Petroleum Products Inc. ("UPPI")    UPPI markets fuel and lubricants to a network of commercial accounts and independent service station operators throughout central and western British Columbia. Fuel sales volumes for the past year were in the range of 180 million litres.    The purchase price for the acquisition was $17.6 million. The consideration consisted of 430,520 Class "C" limited partnership units of Parkland Holdings Limited Partnership (which are exchangeable into trust units on a one-for-one basis) valued at $6.5 million, $10.4 million of cash and $0.7 million of assumed debt.    About Parkland    =-------------    Parkland Income Fund operates retail and wholesale fuels and convenience store businesses under its Fas Gas Plus, Fas Gas, Race Trac Fuels and Short Stop Food Stores brands and through independent branded dealers, and transports fuel through its Petrohaul division. With over 550 locations, Parkland has developed a strong market niche in western and northern Canadian non-urban markets. Through Neufeld Petroleum and Propane the Fund markets propane, gasoline, diesel, lubricants, industrial fluids, agricultural inputs and delivery services to commercial and industrial customers in northern Alberta, northeastern British Columbia and the Northwest Territories. To maximize value for its unitholders, the Fund is focused on the continuous refinement of its retail portfolio, increased revenue diversification through growth in non-fuel revenues and active supply chain management. Parkland operates the Bowden refinery near Red Deer, Alberta producing drilling fluids on a contract basis.    The Fund's units trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX) under the symbol PKI.UN. For more information, visit www.parkland.ca.    Certain information included herein is forward-looking. Forward-looking statements include, without limitation, statements regarding the future financial position, business strategy, budgets, projected costs, capital expenditures, financial results, taxes and plans and objectives of or involving Parkland. Headline: : Glendale Intl Fined C$75,000 For Health And Safety Violation
Story: LONDON, ON, May 28 /CNW/ - Glendale International Corp., an Oakville, Ont.-based company operating as Glendale Recreational Vehicles, a manufacturer of recreational vehicles such as motor homes and trailers, with a plant in Strathroy, Ont., was fined $75,000 today for a violation of the Occupational Health and Safety Act that resulted in serious hand injuries to a young employee.    On March 1, 2006, a worker was using a rag to clean a "glue machine" (a machine that applies glue or resin to materials during construction of recreational vehicles) when the rag got caught in the machine's moving rollers. The worker's right hand and wrist were drawn into the machine, resulting in serious hand injuries, including severe damage to the right thumb. The incident occurred at the company's plant at 145 Queen Street in Strathroy, about 36 kilometres (22 miles) west of London.    Glendale International Corp. pleaded guilty, as an employer, to failing to ensure an in-running nip hazard on the glue machine that endangered the safety of the worker was equipped with, and guarded by, a guard or other device that prevented access to the pinch point, as required by Section 25 of the Regulations for Industrial Establishments. This was contrary to Section 25(1)(c) of the act.    The fine was imposed by Justice of the Peace Elaine Babcock of the Ontario Court of Justice in London. In addition, the court imposed a 25-per-cent victim fine surcharge, as required by the Provincial Offences Act. The surcharge is credited to a special provincial government fund to assist victims of crime.          <<             -------------------------------------------------                            Court Information at a Glance                          -----------------------------                Location:   Ontario Court of Justice                          824 Dundas Street, Courtroom 101                          London, Ontario                Judge:      Justice of the Peace Elaine Babcock                Date/Time:  May 28, 2007, 9 a.m.                Defendant:  Glendale International Corp.                          carrying on business as                          Glendale Recreational Vehicles                Matter:     Occupational Health & Safety               -------------------------------------------------          Disponible en français                                 www.labour.gov.on.ca      >>               /CONTACT: Belinda Sutton, Ministry of Labour, (416) 326-7405; Shantanu Roy, Crown Counsel, Legal Services Branch, Ministry of Labour, (416) 326-6483     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 17:26 ET (21:26 GMT)

Headline: : S&P Assigns Prelim A To Mitsubishi Corp Loan
Story: The following is a press release from Standard & Poor's:     TOKYO (Standard & Poor's) May 28, 2007--Standard & Poor's Ratings Services today assigned its 'A' preliminary rating to Mitsubishi Corp.'s (A/Positive/A-1) Series No. 6 Y20 billion unsecured floating-rate syndicated loan maturing in June 2012. Like ratings on bonds, bank loan ratings are a form of issue rating and take into account the probability of default along with likely recovery prospects. Bank lenders will be treated the same as other senior creditors in the event of a bankruptcy or default since the floating-rate syndicated loan is unsecured. Although the loan does not contain a negative pledge, the seniority of the loan is considered the same as that on Mitsubishi's issued bonds, since the company has not provided any negative pledges when issuing bonds.   A Japanese-language version of this media release is available on Standard & Poor's Research Online at www.researchonline.jp, or via CreditWire Japan on Bloomberg Professional at SPCJ <GO>. Complete ratings information is available to subscribers of RatingsDirect, the real-time Web-based source for Standard & Poor's credit ratings, research, and risk analysis, at www.ratingsdirect.com. Headline: : Strategic Energy Fund Announces Board Approval For Normal Course Issuer Bid And Increase In Mandatory Market Purchase Program>SEF.UN.T
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO and CALGARY, ALBERTA--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - Strategic Energy Management Corp. announces that the Board of Directors has approved a normal course issuer bid for Strategic Energy Fund (the "Fund") (TSX:SEF.UN). A normal course issuer bid allows the Fund to purchase its units for cancellation through the facilities of the Toronto Stock Exchange ("TSX"). Any such purchases will be made by the Fund at the prevailing market price at the time of such purchases in accordance with the requirements of the TSX. The commencement of the normal course issuer bid is subject to review and approval by the TSX.    The Board of Directors has also approved the Fund's Information Circular, which details a proposed amendment to the Fund's mandatory market purchase program. The proposed amendment increases the amount of units which may be purchased by the Fund for cancellation from 0.25% to 1.25% of the outstanding units of the Fund in respect of each calendar quarter. The floor-price at which the mandatory market purchase plan becomes effective will also be increased from less than 90% to less than 95% of the most recently calculated net asset value per unit of the Fund. These proposed amendments will bring the Fund's mandatory market purchase program in-line with similar programs of other investment funds. The Fund will seek unitholder approval of these proposed amendments at the Fund's Annual and Special Meeting to be held on June 28, 2007.    Strategic Energy Fund    Strategic Energy Fund is an investment trust that seeks to provide unitholders with superior rates of return through a diversification strategy focused on investment opportunities within the Canadian energy sector. The Fund invests in established companies, early-stage energy companies and, to a lesser extent, special energy issuers, each with prospects for high growth in the near to medium term and the potential for long-term capital appreciation.    The Fund's investments in established companies, including energy royalty and income trusts, are made with a view to generate sufficient income to permit the Fund to make monthly cash distributions to unitholders.    Investments in early-stage energy companies are focused on both private and public issuers with strong, experienced management teams that have proven track records of enhancing shareholder value and successfully executing exit strategies. As well, the Fund may invest in undervalued issuers where Sentry Select Capital Corp., the investment advisor to the Fund, believes that capital appreciation can be realized.    Trading information and NAV    Strategic Energy Fund units trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol SEF.UN. As of May 24, 2007, the Fund's closing price on the TSX was $9.28 per unit and the most recent net asset value as of May 23, 2007 was $11.49 per unit.    Sentry Select Capital Corp.    Sentry Select Capital Corp. is a Canadian wealth management company who manages over $8 billion in gross assets as of April 30, 2007. The company offers a diverse range of investment products including closed-end trusts, mutual funds, principal-protected notes and flow-through limited partnerships, covering a variety of domestic and global mandates. Sentry Select provides management and advisory services to 31 exchange-listed entities.    Forward- looking statements    This news release contains forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties. These forward-looking statements relate to, among other things, the future performance of the Fund, including the potential for future distributions. These statements reflect Sentry Select's current expectations, but are subject to a number of risks and uncertainties. Due to the many risks and uncertainties, Sentry Select cannot assure that the forward-looking statements contained in this news release will be realized. Headline: : Arriscraft Intl To Be Acquired By General Shale Brick Inc.>AIN.UN.T
Story: CAMBRIDGE, ON, May 28 /CNW/ - Arriscraft International Income Fund (the "Fund") (TSX: AIN.UN) today announced an agreement to sell its Arriscraft International manufactured stone, brick and natural stone masonry products business to General Shale Brick, Inc. ("General Shale") for an aggregate price of $107,000,000, subject to closing adjustments for debt and non-cash working capital. The Fund will be responsible to pay transaction and wind-up related expenses out of the sale proceeds received from General Shale. General Shale, based in Johnson City, Tennessee, is an affiliate of Wienerberger AG, the largest brick company in the world headquartered in Vienna, Austria.    Under terms of the agreement, General Shale will indirectly acquire the Fund's wholly owned subsidiaries, Arriscraft International Limited Partnership and Arriscraft International Holdings (Canada) Inc., which, respectively, operate and hold the Arriscraft International business in Canada and the United States. The bulk of the proceeds will be paid to the Fund's unitholders through the redemption of all outstanding Fund units at a currently estimated cash redemption price of approximately $7.50 per unit. The final redemption price per unit will depend on purchase price adjustments, transaction costs and expenses associated with the wind-up of the Fund. To the extent price adjustments, transaction costs and wind-up expenses are different from the Fund's estimates, or if any unforeseen adjustments, costs or expenses arise, the actual amount paid to unitholders could be different. To offset the impact of the transaction costs and wind-up expenses, General Shale has agreed to partially reimburse the Fund for a portion of those costs and expenses.    The estimated per unit redemption price represents a premium of approximately 26.7% over the 20-day volume weighted average price for the Fund's units on the Toronto Stock Exchange for the period ending on Friday, May 4, 2007, the last full trading day prior to the day the Fund announced it was in discussions with a third party concerning a possible transaction.    The transaction is subject to the approval of the Fund's unitholders at a special meeting, the receipt of regulatory approvals and certain third party consents. It is anticipated that the redemption of Fund units will occur by the end of July 2007. The actual date of the redemption will be set and announced following the closing of the sale transaction. At that time, the board of trustees of the Fund will assess the potential for any other further costs, obligations or liabilities (including tax liabilities) that must be met to wind-up the Fund and intends to establish a reserve for such amounts out of the estimated redemption price per unit noted above. On the redemption of the Fund units, all sale proceeds available after the adjustments, costs and expenses noted above and in excess of the reserve, which reserve the board of trustees currently estimates may be approximately $0.20 per unit, will be distributed to unitholders. The reserve funds, net of any amount paid to satisfy any valid Fund costs, obligations and liabilities after closing, of which none is currently known or expected, will be paid to Fund unitholders as the balance of their unit redemption price in due course once all regulatory filings and tax clearance certificates have been completed or obtained.    David Boles, President and CEO of Arriscraft said, "The acquisition is a good result for our unitholders. It is also a good result for Arriscraft and our employees as General Shale has informed us that it intends to continue to operate the Arriscraft production facilities and grow the Arriscraft business in North America.    Goldsmith, Agio, Helms Securities, Inc., the financial adviser to the board of trustees of the Fund in respect of negotiating the transaction, has provided to the board of trustees an opinion that the estimated consideration to be received by the unitholders under the transaction is fair, from a financial point of view, to the unitholders of the Fund. In addition, the board of trustees retained Crosbie & Company Inc. ("Crosbie") to provide an independent fairness opinion and Crosbie has delivered an opinion to the board of trustees that the estimated consideration to be received by the unitholders under the transaction is fair, from a financial point of view, to the unitholders of the Fund. Based on this advice and other factors, the Fund's board of trustees has unanimously approved the transaction and resolved to recommend that the Fund's unitholders approve the proposed sale to General Shale at a special meeting to be held in July 2007.    F. David Rounthwaite, Chairman, speaking on behalf of the independent trustees said, "We are very pleased to support and to be recommending what we believe is an attractive transaction for the Fund's unitholders. The transaction represents a positive outcome for Arriscraft, its unitholders and its employees, as well as a combination that promises to reinforce Arriscraft's position as a leading North American manufactured stone producer."    Holders of approximately 27.8% of outstanding Fund units have agreed with General Shale to vote their units in favour of the proposed sale transaction.    Further information about the record date for determining unitholders eligible to receive notice of and to vote at a special meeting of unitholders to approve the transaction and the date of the meeting will be made public as soon as practicable. A circular describing the proposed transaction will be mailed to unitholders in connection with the meeting and will be available on the SEDAR website at www.sedar.com. The transaction is expected to close in late July 2007.          <<      Details of the Transaction        The following is a summary of certain details concerning the transaction:        -   Acquired Entities. Subsidiaries of General Shale will acquire          directly and indirectly from Arriscraft International Operating          Trust, the Fund's wholly owned subsidiary, all the outstanding          securities of (i) Arriscraft International Limited Partnership, the          owner and operator of Arriscraft's Canadian business, and          (ii) Arriscraft International Holdings (Canada) Inc., the holding          company that indirectly owns Arriscraft's U.S. operating entity,          Arriscraft International LLC.        -   Outstanding Units. Immediately prior to closing, assuming the          exercise of all outstanding options and exchange of exchangeable          securities, there will be approximately 9,934,167 units of the Fund          outstanding.        -   Purchase Price Adjustments. The aggregate purchase price for the          Arriscraft business will be $107 million. The purchase price will be          reduced by the total amount of indebtedness of Arriscraft at closing          and will be increased dollar for dollar to the extent non-cash          working capital of the Fund exceeds $13.5 million, up to a maximum          purchase price increase of $2.75 million. Out of these proceeds, the          Fund will pay the estimated transaction and wind-up costs. General          Shale will partially reimburse transaction and wind-up costs that          exceed current expectations. Also, out of the proceeds, Arriscraft          International Limited Partnership will pay the severance costs to the          current president and CEO and current CFO of Arriscraft (who will not          be continuing in those roles post-closing) that are payable as a          result of change-of-control provisions in their employment contracts.          These severance costs are estimated to be $2.45 million.        -   Closing Conditions. Completion of the transaction is subject to          customary closing conditions including receipt of all necessary          approvals such as unitholder and regulatory approvals and certain          other conditions, including Arriscraft's indebtedness not exceeding          $32 million plus the actual CEO and CFO severance costs and          Arriscraft having at least $13 million of non-cash working capital.        -   Voting Support. Holders of approximately 27.8% of outstanding Fund          units have agreed in writing with General Shale to vote their units          in favour of the transaction. The voting agreements are of a          customary nature and terminate if the board of trustees terminates          the agreement with General Shale by exercising its fiduciary out          rights. The unitholders who have agreed to vote their units of the          Fund in favour of the transaction are a corporation owned by the          former owner of the Arriscraft business that owns all the special          voting units of the Fund, the management group who own all of the          Restricted A units and Restricted B units of the Fund (who have          agreed to give up certain additional distribution rights on their          units to receive the same consideration per unit as other          unitholders), the current president and CEO and the current CFO.        -   Minority Approval. The approval of the majority of "minority" holders          for purposes of Ontario Securities Commission Rule 61-501 and          Regulation Q-27 of the Autorité des marchés financiers du Québec will          also be required. Units held by (i) a corporation owned by the former          owner of the Arriscraft business, which holds a subordinated          unsecured exchangeable debenture issued by Arriscraft International          Limited Partnership that will be paid off at closing, and (ii) the          current President and CEO and the current CFO, who will receive          severance payments at closing, which represent in the aggregate          approximately 10% of the outstanding voting units or a total of          981,033 units, will be excluded from such minority vote.        -   Redemption Procedure. At or prior to the closing of the sale          transaction, the board of trustees will assess the potential for any   (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 07:53 ET (11:53 GMT)

Headline: BCP CEO Against Bylaws Changes; 40% To Vote Against -Paper
Story: LISBON (Dow Jones)--Banco Comercial Portugues' (BCP.LB) Chief Executive Paulo Teixeira Pinto is against the changes in the bank's bylaws proposed by the lender's supervisory board, to be voted at a shareholders meeting Monday, weekly Expresso reported Saturday without citing sources.   The proposed changes, which intend to make a takeover of the bank more difficult after its failed bid for smaller rival Banco BPI (BPI.LB) earlier this month, are expected to be rejected by 40% of the votes.   The supervisory board, which is headed by Jorge Jardim Goncalves, founder and former chief executive of BCP, proposes giving the supervisory board the right to appoint the executive board and require a 75% majority of issued votes to change the company's bylaws, up from the current 66%.     Newspaper Web site: http://www.expresso.pt     -By Lisbon Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 351-21-319-1863     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 02:24 ET (06:24 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Chile Antofagasta Inks Early Labor Deal With 2 Unions - Repot
Story: SANTIAGO (Dow Jones)--Chilean copper miner Antofagasta Minerals, a unit of Antofagasta plc (ANTO.LN), signed new contracts with two unions ahead of the legally mandated schedule, La Segunda afternoon daily reported Monday.   Antofagasta reached agreements with the Mina-Puerto union at its Los Pelambres Mine and with the Michilla union at the Michilla mine, the newspaper reported.   Based on local labor laws, contract talks with these two unions were scheduled to begin in September.   At Pelambres, Antofagasta reached a 45-month deal, which will expire in February 2011. The 269 workers of the Mina-Puerto union obtained a 3.6% wage increase and a one-time 7.4 million peso ($14,103) early signing bonus, union president Cesar Modinger told the newspaper.   According to the leader, 91% of union members approved the early deal.   At Michilla, the company reached a deal with 255 union members, or 92% of union-eligible workers. A four-year contract was signed, and the newspaper didn't provide additional contract details.   The company spokesman wasn't immediatly available to confirm the deals.   Antofagasta still has to negotiate contracts with a smaller union at Pelambres, which represents about 30% of the union-eligible work force, and with a union at its wholly-owned El Tesoro mine.   Antofagasta is the fourth-largest copper miner in Chile, the world's largest copper producer. The London-listed company produced 465,000 metric tons of copper last year.     Newspaper Web site: http://www.lasegunda.cl     -By Carolina Pica, Dow Jones Newswires; 56-2-460-8544; carolina.pica@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 16:49 ET (20:49 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
