Headline: Lottomatica's GTECH Secures 10-Yr Kansas Lottery Contract
Story: ROME (Dow Jones)--Italian gaming company Lottomatica SpA (LTO.MI) said Monday its U.S. unit GTECH Corp. secured a 10-year contract to run the Kansas Lottery that will boost the unit's revenue by about EUR60 million from the third-quarter of 2008.   Lottomatica said GTECH will provide an online lottery system, terminals, wireless Internet Protocol-communications network and ongoing services for the Kansas Lottery.   "We are pleased to continue our long-standing partnership with the Kansas Lottery," said W. Bruce Turner, chief executive of Lottomatica and GTECH, in a statement.   The Kansas Lottery has been a GTECH client since 1987.   The 10-year contract is expected to start July 1.     -Liam Moloney, Dow Jones Newswires; +39 06 678 2543; liam.moloney@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 11:41 ET (15:41 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: India Ranbaxy Gets Rights To Sell 13 Dermatology Pdts In US
Story: NEW DELHI (Dow Jones)--Indian drug-maker Ranbaxy Laboratories Ltd. (500359.BY) Monday said it has acquired rights to sell 13 dermatology products in the U.S.   The rights were acquired from Bristol-Myers Squibb Company (BMY) through its wholly-owned subsidiary, Ranbaxy Laboratories Inc., the company said in a statement.   "It (the acquisition) enables Ranbaxy to establish an immediate presence in the high value segments of Dermatitis, Psoriasis, Anti-fungals and Scabies, in addition to Acne, where the company already has a dominant brand," said Ranbaxy's vice president and regional director for North America, Venkat Krishnan, in the statement.       -By Shaleen Agrawal, Dow Jones Newswires; 91-11-23074020; shaleen.agrawal@dowjones.com   -Edited by David Bottomley     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 04:19 ET (08:19 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: AEM, Part Of Gas Mkt Probe, Says "Confident" Of Outcome >E
Story: MILAN (Dow Jones)--AEM SpA (AEM.MI), Italy's biggest municipal utility, said Monday it is part of an investigation by Milan magistrates into the country's natural gas market, adding it is "confident" of the probe's outcome.   An AEM spokesman confirmed the utility is being investigated. He said the company has made all its documentation available to the judicial authorities and is "fully cooperating."   Chief Executive Giuliano Zuccoli is being investigated, as well as some of the managers of AEM, the spokesman said. He added the probe focuses on measuring instruments used for gas transported and sold by the company to wholesalers, not that sold to retail consumers.   The companies in the sector are being investigated for possible fraud, excise duty violations and manipulation of measuring instruments, according to local newswire Ansa, without citing sources.   Under Italian law, magistrates are not allowed to comment on ongoing investigations.   Earlier Monday, Eni SpA (E), Italy's biggest oil and natural gas company by volume, said the fiscal police raided its offices and seized some documents in an investigation into measuring instruments for the transport and distribution of gas in the country.   Eni said in a statement other companies in the sector are involved in the investigation, but didn't name them.   The Rome-based company said its Chief Executive Paolo Scaroni was under investigation over the matter.   At 1141 GMT, AEM shares were down 1.3%, or EUR0.04, at EUR2.77 in an overall flat market.   -Liam Moloney, Dow Jones Newswires; +39 06 678 2543; liam.moloney@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 08:08 ET (12:08 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Nokia and Nokia Siemens Networks Prepare for Growth of Telecommunications in Africa at CTO Roundtable
Story: ESPOO, Finland, May 28 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ --     - Telecommunications Technology will in the Coming Years Have a Profound Impact on Many Societies in Africa, Contributing Largely to the Economic Growth and Wealth of Millions of People on the Continent     - This Development, and Issues Related to the Regulatory Environment Supporting the Foreseen Growth, will be the Major Themes of the Commonwealth Telecommunications Organisation's (CTO) European-African Telecommunications Roundtable in Helsinki and Bonn, a Meeting That Will Bring Together Leading Decision Makers From Africa, Europe and the Telecoms Industry     The CTO meeting will assemble high-level telecommunications officials from the organisation's African member countries, with participants representing communications ministries and regulators from Ghana, Kenya, Namibia, Nigeria, Rwanda, South Africa, Tanzania, and Uganda. Officials from Finnish and German government and industry will also take part.     The roundtable is built around themes including the telecommunications ecosystem: the socio-economic impact of information and communication technology (ICT) and telecommunications, case studies from countries including Finland, and how similar development can be encouraged in New Growth Markets; and Europe-Africa cooperation, including European ICT initiatives in Africa and project financing.     Nokia Siemens Networks and Nokia are playing a key role in the meeting, contributing speakers and engaging in the dialogue that aims to increase understanding between the two continents, initiate concrete projects and lay the foundation for future discussions.     "While people around the world share the universal desire to connect with others, Nokia has dedicated itself to develop an unparalleled insight into the specific needs and aspirations of individuals in emerging markets. Less than a month ago, Nokia launched seven new phones based on this in-depth understanding, which are not only designed to be accessible to these consumers, but to also help spark development within the communities that they live and work," said Veli Sundback, executive vice president of corporate relations and responsibility for Nokia.     "By 2015 we expect five billion people will be connected by wire and wirelessly from one end of the planet to the other, and the clear majority of these people will come from new growth markets in Asia and Africa. We are committed to connecting the world, and this event is an excellent opportunity to engage key stakeholders to help make this vision a reality," said Lauri Kivinen, head of corporate affairs, Nokia Siemens Networks.     The CTO European/African Telecommunications Roundtable will run from May 28-31 in Helsinki, and then continues until June 1 in Bonn.        About Nokia     Nokia is the world leader in mobility, driving the transformation and growth of the converging Internet and communications industries. Nokia makes a wide range of mobile devices and provides people with experiences in music, navigation, video, television, imaging, games and business mobility through these devices. Nokia also provides equipment, solutions and services for communications networks.        About Nokia Siemens Networks     Nokia Siemens Networks is a leading global enabler of communications services. The company provides a complete, well-balanced product portfolio of mobile and fixed network infrastructure solutions and addresses the growing demand for services with 20,000 service professionals worldwide. The combined pro-forma net sales of EUR17.1 billion in fiscal year 2006 make Nokia Siemens Networks one of the largest telecommunications infrastructure companies. Nokia Siemens Networks has operations in some 150 countries and is headquartered in Espoo, Finland. It combines Nokia's Networks Business Group and the carrier related businesses of Siemens Communications.    www.nokiasiemensnetworks.com        About the CTO     The work of the CTO goes back to its creation in 1901. It is an international development partnership between Commonwealth and non-Commonwealth governments, business and civil society organisations. It provides the international community with effective means to help bridge the digital divide and achieve social and economic development, by delivering to developing countries unique knowledge-sharing programmes in the use of information and communication technologies (ICT) in the specific areas of telecommunications, IT, broadcasting and the Internet. www.cto.int    www.nokia.com    SOURCE  Nokia       /CONTACT: Media Enquiries: CTO, Toby Davies, Tel. +44-(0)-208-834-1578, Email: t.davies@cto.int; Nokia, Communications, Tel. +358-7180-34900, Email: press.office@nokia.com; Nokia Siemens Networks, Media relations, Tel. +358-7180-31451, Email: mediarelations@nsn.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 10:22 ET (14:22 GMT)

Headline: UPDATE: Brazil Steel Co CSN Workers Threaten Strike -Estado
Story: (Adds details of meeting Tuesday, background on potential agreement, and CSN share performance Monday)     SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--The union representing workers at Brazilian integrated steelmaker Companhia Siderurgica Nacional (SID), or CSN, could go on strike as early as Wednesday, the union's president told the Estado news agency Monday.   "If we don't have a deal with management by Wednesday, we'll strike," said union President Renato Soares Ramos.   Union officials told Estado that workers and management officials will meet Tuesday to discuss a deal. The meeting is scheduled for 8 a.m.   The union will then meet with workers to vote on the offer on Wednesday.   Workers want salaries adjusted upward by more than 40%.   The salary agreement would cover 8,000 workers at the company's Volta Redonda mill and 500 workers at CSN's Casa de Pedra iron ore mine in Minas Gerais state.   CSN shares underperformed the broader market Monday, rising 0.8% to a preliminary close at 100.80 Brazilian reals ($51.88). The benchmark Ibovespa stocks index rose 1.0% to 52,130 points.     -By Jeff Fick, Dow Jones Newswires; 55-11-3145-1481; jeff.fick@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 16:23 ET (20:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Eni Says Police Seize Documents In Gas Measuring Probe
Story: ROME (Dow Jones)--Eni SpA (E), Italy's biggest oil and natural gas company by volumes, said Monday the fiscal police raided its offices and seized some documents in an investigation into measuring instruments for the transport and distribution of gas in the country.   Eni said its companies involved in the probe were gas transmission company Snam Rete Gas SpA (SRG.MI) and distributor Italgas.   Eni said in a statement other companies in the sector are involved in the investigation.   The Rome-based company said its Chief Executive Paolo Scaroni was under investigation over the matter.   Eni said the probe centers on the venturi tube meters, which it added "have always been used in Italy and abroad," while the documents seized dated from 2003.   It said the probe was part of an investigation started by Milan magistrates last year.   The company said these meters aren't used for calculating the gas utility bills of consumers.     -Liam Moloney, Dow Jones Newswires; +39 06 678 2543; liam.moloney@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 06:53 ET (10:53 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Colombia's Valorem Sells Aluminio Reynolds To Colombian Arfel
Story: BOGOTA (Dow Jones)--Colombia's holding Valorem, formerly known as Valores Bavaria (VALOREM.BO), said late Friday it sold its aluminum company Aluminio Reynolds Santo Domingo SA to the Bogota-based company Industrias Arfel SA.   The company didn't say how much the transaction was worth.   Valorem's press officer said she would return phone calls seeking comment about the sale.   Luis Miguel Garcia, chief executive of Industrial Arfel couldn't be reached for comment.   "The transaction seeks to secure the growth of Aluminio Reynolds in the future, in a sector that requires economies of scale," Valorem said in a press release.   Industrias Arfel controls the Medellin-based IMUSA, a manufacturer of a broad range of aluminum and stainless-steel products for the kitchen, and plastic products for the home. Arfel also controls other aluminum companies such as Dinalsa, Emma & Cia and Alumina SA.   Valorem said the acquisition is pending the approval of the antitrust watchdog, known as Superintendencia de Industria y Comercio.   Since 2004, Valorem has been selling non-strategic assets, helping the company to reduce losses and now to report a profit.    In December, it sold its Colombian cable company TV Cable SA to Telefonos de Mexico (TMX).    In October, it agreed to sell a 99% stake in helicopter company Helicopteros Nacionales de Colombia, or Helicol, to Brazilian businessman German Efromovich.   In late 2004, Valorem sold its 50% stake in troubled airline Avianca to Brazil's Synergy Group, which Efromovich also controls.   Synergy and Efromovich now own 100% of Avianca, and pulled the airline out of bankruptcy, agreeing to inject $63 million of fresh capital and assuming nearly $220 million of debt.   Valorem posted a net profit of 40.67 billion Colombian pesos ($19.3 million) in the first three months of the year, from a loss of COP10 billion in the same period of 2006.    Shares of Valorem rose 2.3% to COP450 ($0.2) per share, the sharpest gainer in Monday's equity market, which fell 0.5% as of noon.     -By Diana Delgado, Dow Jones Newswires; 571-6001980; diana.delgado@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 13:29 ET (17:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Mexico Stocks Open Lower In Slow Trade; IPC Index Down 0.2%
Story: By Anthony Harrup   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     MEXICO CITY (Dow Jones)--Mexican stocks opened lower Monday in light trading with U.S. markets closed for Memorial Day.   Around 10:40 a.m. EDT (1440 GMT), the market's IPC index of leading issues was off 0.2% to 30,643.66 points. Volume was 3.5 million shares worth 70.1 million pesos ($6.5 million).   The CPO shares of media group Televisa (TV), now ex-dividend, were off 1.8% to MXN62.40. The company plans to pay dividends equivalent to MXN1.45 a CPO share on May 31.   Retailer Wal-Mart de Mexico (WALMEX.MX) V shares were down 0.8% to MXN41.57.   The A shares of airline company Aeromexico (AMEXICO.MX) were up 2.6% to MXN2.36, gaining for a second straight day after the Reforma newspaper reported Friday that the controlling shareholder of low-cost carrier Avolar plans to make an offer for Aeromexico.   The government plans to sell its majority stake in Aeromexico this year, and has said it will do so via a secondary share offering unless an offer emerges.   -By Anthony Harrup, Dow Jones Newswires; (5255) 5080 3450; anthony.harrup@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 10:53 ET (14:53 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Rhéaume And Beckett Joins Kangaroo Media Board
Story: MONTREAL, May 28 /CNW Telbec/ - Kangaroo Media Inc.("Kangaroo" or the "Corporation") is pleased to announce that at the corporation's Annual Meeting held on May 24, 2007, the shareholders elected Alain Rhéaume and Justin F. Beckett as new member of the Board of Directors of Kangaroo.    Mr. Alain Rhéaume is founder and managing partner of Trio Capital Inc., a private equity firm involved in the telecommunications and new media sectors. He has more than twenty-five years of experience in senior management positions, in both the public and private sectors. Mr. Rhéaume has directed strategic planning, financing, treasury and sale and acquisition activities, participated in the creation and implementation of investment projects and conducted business operations in the telecommunications sector. From 1988 to 1996, Mr. Rhéaume was the Associate Deputy Minister and then Deputy Minister of Finance of the government of Québec. In 1996, Mr. Rhéaume joined Microcell Telecommunications Inc., the wireless telecommunications company carrying on business under the FIDO brand where, for almost ten years, he was first Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer, then successfully executive vice-president corporate services and president and Chief Operating Officer, thus participating in the management of all phases of development of the business. Mr. Rhéaume holds a License in business administration from the University of Laval. He is a member of the board of directors of numerous public and private companies.    Mr. Justin F. Beckett is the founder, President and Chief Executive Officer of Fluid Media Networks, Inc. Prior to founding Fluid Media Networks in 2004, Mr. Beckett founded and served from 2001 to 2004 as the Chief Executive Officer of SkillJam Technologies Corporation which was subsequently sold to FUN Technologies Inc. From 2001 to 2003, Mr. Beckett was a consultant to Visutel Technologies and in 2000 Mr. Beckett founded Music Gaming, Inc., which was sold to Intermix/MySpace in 2001. In 2002, Mr. Beckett co-founded Measurematics, Inc. an online performance measurement service catering to non-profit organizations. Prior to his focus on Internet-based consumer product applications, Mr. Beckett was an Executive Vice President and principal of Sloan Financial Group, a diversified financial services firm. Mr. Beckett received his Bachelor of Arts degree from Duke University.    Other Board members are: Marc Arseneau, Pierre Boivin, Jean Arseneau, Alain Charette, Jean-Denis Talon, Raynald Brière, George J. Rossi and André P. Brosseau.    About Kangaroo Media Inc.    Kangaroo Media Inc., with its unique product, Kangaroo.TV, gives fans the superstar experience by letting them create their own live-action sporting event on site. Its technology delivers video, audio and data in real-time to each fan's hand-held Kangaroo TV. Kangaroo Media is a market leader and currently available in several top tier sports properties, and partnered with internationally renowned brands. Headquartered near Montreal, Canada, Kangaroo Media is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange (www.tsx.com) as KTV. For more information visit www.kangaroo.tv.    Forward-looking statements    About Kangaroo Media Inc. This news release contains forward-looking information. These statements relate to future events or future performance and reflect management's current expectations and assumptions. Such forward-looking statements reflect management's current beliefs and are based on information currently available to management of Kangaroo Media. A number of factors could cause actual events, performance or results to differ materially from the events, performance and results discussed in the forward-looking statements. These forward-looking statements are made as of the date hereof and Kangaroo Media does not assume any obligation to update or revise them to reflect new events or circumstances.    (The TSX does not accept responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of    this release.)    %SEDAR: 00019975EF         /CONTACT: Claude Michaud, Chief Financial Officer, Kangaroo Media, (514) 595-2004, (450) 595-2010, cmichaud@kangaroo.tv; Media Relations: Julie Perrier, Edelman, (514) 844-6665, ext. 229, julie.perrier@edelman.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 17:25 ET (21:25 GMT)

Headline: : Warnex Engages GMP Securities L.P. As Adviser>WNX.T
Story: LAVAL, QC, May 28 /CNW/ - Warnex Inc. (TSX: WNX) today announced that is has engaged GMP Securities L.P., an institutional investment dealer with locations across Canada, to act as advisor in its previously announced review of strategic options.    The Company announced on April 24, 2007, that is has initiated a review of various strategic options for its ongoing laboratory services business in order to enhance shareholder value. These options include, but are not limited to, partnerships, mergers or the sale of the Company.    Warnex provides no assurance that the initiation of a process to explore strategic options will result in a transaction. No decision has been made to enter into any transaction at this time and no timetable has been set for the completion of this process. The Company does not currently intend to disclose developments with respect to the exploration of strategic options unless and until its Board of Directors has approved a specific transaction.    About GMP Securities L.P.    GMP Securities L.P. is a leading independent Canadian investment dealer focused on investment banking and institutional equities for corporate clients and institutional investors. GMP Securities L.P. can be found on the web at gmpsecurities.com.    About Warnex    Warnex (www.warnex.ca) is a life sciences company devoted to protecting public health by providing laboratory services to the pharmaceutical and healthcare sectors. Warnex's analytical services division provides pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies with a variety of quality control services, including traditional chemistry, chromatography, microbiology, method development and validation, and stability studies. Warnex's bioanalytical services division specializes in bioequivalence and bioavailability studies for clinical trials. Warnex's medical laboratories division focuses on genetic and biochemical testing for the healthcare industry and has extensive expertise in genetic testing for human identification, molecular diagnostics, and pharmacogenetics. Headline: FOCUS: SAS Sweden Crew Strike Imperils Airline's Recovery
Story: By Adam Ewing   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     STOCKHOLM (Dow Jones)--A strike by Scandinavian airline SAS AB's (SAS.SK) Swedish cabin crew is throwing the company's restructuring plans and a much hoped-for financial recovery into jeopardy.   Swedish SAS workers have been on strike since Friday over demands for more holiday time and longer meal breaks between flights, grounding some 300 flights a day in Sweden at a cost of around 20 million Swedish kronor ($2.9 million) a day.   SAS Sweden said talks with cabin crew union HTF were continuing Monday but no agreement had been reached and flights on Tuesday had been canceled.   The dispute highlights the challenge facing SAS and many of Europe's national carriers as they strive to remain profitable in the face of competition from low-cost airlines, high wage costs and generous working conditions that eat into margins.   SAS is slowly returning to profitability after five years of losses, stemming from a downturn in air travel after the Sept. 11, 2001 attacks on the U.S. and the outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome, or SARS, in Asia in 2002 to 2003. The airline, which is 50%-owned by the governments of Sweden, Denmark and Norway, swung to a pretax loss of SEK1.14 billion in 2001 from a SEK2.83 billion profit in 2000. After initiating a SEK2.5 billion program to cut costs and sell off non-core assets, SAS reported a 2006 pretax profit of SEK292 million and said after the first quarter it expects continued growth in the global economy and its markets.   As part of the restructuring to help the airline recover, SAS workers accepted concessions in their contracts but the latest strike is an effort by cabin crew to reinstate some benefits and conditions.   "Things are good at the company. Why can't we get some of that back now?" said HTF negotiator Tommy Mases.   Talks have focused on working conditions rather than wages. SAS flight attendants in Sweden earn an average $56,131 a year, including allowances, for a 26-hour working week. Most of HTF's 10 or so demands are focused on working conditions rather than salary increases, Mases said.   "We want one weekend a month off. We want at least 20 minutes to eat between flights," said Mases. "Sometimes we only have five minutes or no time at all to eat. Somewhere you have to balance work with how much somebody needs food and rest."   Despite a return to profitability, SAS says it still has work to do and says further concessions would hinder the company's five-year strategic program, to be launched mid-June. SAS says the new plan will contain measures to boost revenue and additional cost-cutting measures to lift profitability.   SAS Sweden spokeswoman Ulrika Fager said HTF's demands equate to a 25% increase in staff costs each year compared with the 10.3% increase over three years SAS had previously accepted.   "HTF's demands make us less flexible than our Swedish competitors," Fager told Dow Jones Newswires. "We have to reach an agreement that can keep us competitive."   The latest strike in Sweden follows a three-day wildcat strike in Denmark last month over working conditions, which cost SAS an estimated SEK100 million.   SAS has faced 100 strikes in the past 10 years, 73 of which were illegal strikes in Denmark. SAS Spokesman Bertil Ternert said newly-appointed Chief Executive Mats Jansson is "tired" of the labor battles, having faced three in his first five months on the job.   "SAS Sweden has to play hardball," said Lars Heindorff, ABG Sundal Collier analyst. "They can't afford not to. First it was the Danes and now it's the Swedes. Management needs to get this fixed now."   HTF's Mases said he expects another offer from the airline later Monday.   SAS has a 45% share of the Nordic market with SAS Sweden making up 33% of the total. The largest Nordic competitor is Finnair (FIA1S.HE) with 14%, followed by FL Group's (FL.IC) Sterling with 7% and Ryanair (RYAAY) with 5%. The company  is chiefly a short-to-medium haul business carrier.   SAS shares in Stockholm, which have doubled in the last 12 months, traded flat at SEK153.50 at 1349 GMT Monday, underperforming a higher broader market.   Company Web site: http://www.sasgroup.net   -By Adam Ewing, Dow Jones Newswires; +46 8 545 130 95; adam.ewing@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 10:23 ET (14:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: CVRD Declines Comment On Reports It's Eyeing Cleveland-Cliffs
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--Brazilian mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (RIO), or CVRD, declined comment Monday on reports that it is in talks to acquire U.S.-based iron ore producer Cleveland-Cliffs (CLF).   "CVRD does not comment about market rumors," the company's press office said.   Last week, several press reports said CVRD, the world's largest producer and exporter of iron ore and iron pellets, was in talks to acquire Cleveland-Cliffs. Cleveland-Cliffs shares surged 10% Friday amid continuing consolidation in the mining sector.   On Monday, CVRD shares outperformed the broader market in early trade, rising 0.7% to 71.70 Brazilian reals ($36.73) at 1334 GMT. The overall market as measured by the Ibovespa stocks index was 0.5% higher at 51,869 points.   Cleveland-Cliffs is North America's largest producer of iron pellets, prized by steelmakers for their efficient use in blast furnaces. In 2006, the company produced 20.8 million tons of iron pellets in the U.S. and 7.7 million metric tons of Australian iron ore.   The company recently signed agreements to acquire a 30% stake in the Amapa mining unit of Brazilian mining and metals company MMX Mineracao Mineracao e Metalicos SA (MMXM3.BR) and a 45% share of the Sonoma coal project in Queensland, Australia, from closely held QCoal Pty Ltd.     -By Jeff Fick, Dow Jones Newswires; 55-11-3145-1481; jeff.fick@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 09:56 ET (13:56 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Canada Liberal Party Leader Asks Foreign Takeover Halt -CP
Story: NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Canada's Liberal Party leader, Stephane Dion, Monday called on the federal government to halt foreign takeovers of Canadian businesses until a blue-ribbon panel has a chance to review the practice, Canadian Press reported.   It's the federal government's responsibility to ensure Canada's approach to foreign ownership is keeping up with the practices of global competitors, Dion told a news conference, according to Canadian Press.   "The Conservative government should immediately review the rules governing foreign takeovers to better promote both global champions and the fair treatment of Canadian companies," Dion said.   "The Investment Canada Act has not been reviewed for 20 years, and recent developments suggest that in some areas the act may be tilted against both Canadian companies and the national interest."   The call comes on the heels of a spate of foreign takeovers during the last 18 months in which Canadian icons such as Inco, Dofasco and Falconbridge have been acquired by companies from Brazil, Europe and the United States.   Dion said a panel of experts should review all issues surrounding foreign takeovers and make recommendations on changes to the act within three months. Decisions on major foreign acquisitions and any changes to foreign ownership rules should be suspended until after the process has been completed, he said.   The Commons finance and industry committees should also hold hearings on foreign takeovers during the summer break, he added.   Dion said Alcoa Inc.'s (AA) recent takeover bid for Alcan Inc. (AL) raises the question of whether reciprocity should be a factor governing takeovers in Canada. Alcoa's home state of Pennsylvania has rules that would make it extremely difficult for Alcan to take over Alcoa.   Since Alcoa comes from a jurisdiction that protects it from takeover, it must be determined whether Alcoa should face tougher rules in Canada when it seeks to take over Alcan, he said, according to Canadian Press.   As well, Investment Canada makes decisions based on whether it judges a takeover to confer "net economic benefit" on Canada, said Dion, adding not a single takeover has been blocked in many years.   While the takeovers of Inco and Falconbridge by foreign companies were judged to confer net economic benefit, Dion said many would argue that the net economic benefit for Canada would have been greater if Inco and Falconbridge had achieved a made-in-Canada merger, or if, for example, a three-way merger of Alcan, Inco and Falconbridge had been contemplated, Canadian Press reported.   He said such possibilities cannot be considered under the current one-at-a-time approach adopted by Investment Canada.   In addition, several U.S. states have rules that, unlike Canada, allow corporate boards to consider the impact of a takeover on stakeholders other than shareholders. Ottawa has a responsibility to look at whether Canada should consider the adoption of such rules, he said.   Finally, according to Canadian Press, he noted some business leaders have suggested that certain resource industries should be considered strategically important.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 11:30 ET (15:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: CVTech Unit Gets C$6M Pact In New Hampshire >CVT.T
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   CVTech Group Inc.'s (CVT.T) Thiro USA unit has received a C$6 million contract from Public Service of New Hampshire for the reconstruction of their 115Kv transmission line from the Greggs Substation in Gofftown, N.H. to the Jackman Substation in Hillsborough, N.H.   CVTech said the contract includes the rebuilding of 247 wood H-Frame structures along the transmission line.   CVTech, based in Drummondville, Que., is a management company with subsidiaries specializing in continuously variable transmissions.   -Tara Zachariah; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 14:45 ET (18:45 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Court Rejects TNK-BP Challenge On Kovykta Gas Field -Report
Story: MOSCOW (Dow Jones)--A Russian court Monday threw out a lawsuit filed by Anglo-Russian energy venture TNK-BP (TNKB.RS), clearing the way for the withdrawal of the company's license to operate the Kovykta gas field, news agency Interfax reported.   The Irkutsk District Arbitration Court upheld a petition by two Russian regulators against TNK-BP subsidiary Rusia Petroleum (PTRL.RS), which holds the license to the field.   Rusia Petroleum said it may appeal the decision, although an official in Irkutsk said the company believes the Natural Resources Ministry will eventually revoke the license.   Rusia Petroleum had filed the suit to challenge a state inspection that uncovered violations of the license agreement at Kovykta.   TNK-BP officials freely admit that Rusia Petroleum produced only a fraction of the 9 billion cubic meters of gas it was obliged to produce last year according to its license, although have cited a lack of local demand for gas and limited access to export markets.   The company has been stifled from selling the gas to China and South Korea by Russian gas monopoly OAO Gazprom (GSPBEX.RS), with whom TNK-BP has sought in vain for an agreement on exports.   By law, Gazprom is the only company in Russia allowed to export gas.     Agency Web site: http://www.interfax.ru     -By Moscow Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; +7 495 974 8055     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 06:41 ET (10:41 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: BCP Removes Bylaws Change From Shareholders Meeting Agenda
Story: LISBON (Dow Jones)--The supervisory board of Banco Comercial Portugues (BCP.LB) removed a proposal to change the bank's bylaws from its annual shareholders meeting agenda, a spokesman said late Monday.   The meeting, which started at 1430 GMT, was meant to vote on a proposal to change the bank's bylaws, in order to make BCP a less-likely target for an unsolicited bid after its failed takeover attempt for smaller rival Banco BPI (BPI.LB) earlier this month.   The supervisory board, which is headed by Jorge Jardim Goncalves, founder and former chief executive of BCP, proposed giving the supervisory board the right to appoint the executive board and require a 75% majority of issued votes to change the company's bylaws, up from 66%.   Approximately 65% of the share capital was represented at the shareholders meeting, a person close to the situation told Dow Jones Newswires.   At least two key shareholders have come out against the bylaws changes: Portuguese magnate Joe Berardo, who holds nearly 4% of BCP, and Banco Privado Portugues, which has a 2% stake.   BCP was among top gainers in Lisbon Monday, closing up 2.3%, or EUR0.08, at EUR3.5, in an overall higher market.     -By Filipa Cunha, Dow Jones Newswires; +351-21-3191863; filipa.cunha@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 17:29 ET (21:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Abu Dhabi IPIC To Reduce $5B Fujairah Refinery Cost -Official
Story: DUBAI (Dow Jones)--Abu Dhabi's International Petroleum Investment Co. is revising a plan to build a $5 billion refinery in the U.A.E. after potential partner ConocoPhillips voiced concerns about the project's cost.   The refinery is "an active project" but the Abu Dhabi company, known as IPIC, will "do further work on the study" to reduce the project's budget, an IPIC official, who declined to be named told Dow Jones Newswires Monday.   IPIC and ConocoPhillips (COP) in July last year launched a study examining the feasibility of the 500,000-barrel-a-day refinery in Fujairah, located at the entrance to the Strait of Hormuz, which connects the Persian Gulf with the Arabian Sea.   The Abu Dhabi government-owned company remains committed to implementing the project but wants to keep a lid on costs, the official said.   Houston-based ConocoPhillips, the second-largest U.S. refiner, said in April that rising costs had cast doubts on its participation in the Fujairah refinery under the original plan.   Project costs in the Middle East have soared as governments are spending their oil revenues on building and expanding industries and infrastructure, leading to a shortage of contractors, raw materials, equipment and qualified labor, which in turn has driven up prices.   Kuwait decided to rethink a similar size refinery project after bids to build the plant came in at more than double its original budget of $6.3 billion in December.   IPIC is "talking to several potential partners with expertise in operations and marketing" about participating in the Fujairah refinery, the official said.   Under the original agreement signed last year, IPIC and ConocoPhillips were expected to form a 51:49 joint-venture to own and operate the refinery, which will process crude oil from Abu Dhabi's Upper Zakum field.   Persian Gulf governments, flush with cash from three years' of high oil prices, are investing in new crude oil refineries to meet rising global demand and tighter specifications for products such as gasoline and diesel, notably in Europe and in the U.S.   IPIC, formed in 1984, is also looking at investing in a refinery in northern Africa, according to the official.   "It's in the works, there will hopefully be an announcement soon," he said.   In addition, the investment firm is moving ahead with plans to build a 1.5 million barrel a day pipeline that will transport crude from the onshore Habshan field in Abu Dhabi to an oil export terminal at Fujairah.   IPIC aims to shortlist contractors for early engineering works on the pipeline within "two-three weeks," the official said.   Once completed in 2010, the pipeline will allow for oil exports to bypass the Strait of Hormuz, the world's most important crude tanker route, through which about 17 million barrels, or 20% of global consumption, are being shipped every day.   -By Oliver Klaus, Dow Jones Newswires, +9714 364 4961 Oliver.Klaus@dowjones.com   Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 10:37 ET (14:37 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: TNK-BP 99% Sure To Lose Kovykta Licence Fri -Russian Official
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--A TKN-BP (TNKB.RS) unit is "99% sure to lose" its Kovykta gas field license Friday following a second inspection and the dismissal of the company's legal challenge, a Russian regulatory official said Monday.   Oleg Mitvol, the deputy head of Russia's environmental watchdog Rosprirodnadzor, said he had "sent the papers" of a second inspection on the project to Russia's federal subsoil resources agency Rosnedra.   The inspection showed the TNK-BP unit holding the license, Rusia Petroleum (PTRL.RS), had failed to reach its required gas output level.   He said it is "99% sure" Rosnedra will pull the license Friday in accordance with Russian law.   "This is the last stage of procedure to lose the license. There is 1% it will be other way. In Britain, it would be 100%," he said.   The statements come after a Russian court earlier Monday threw out a suit filed by Anglo-Russian energy venture TNK-BP, clearing the way for the withdrawal of the company's license to operate the Kovykta gas field. The Irkutsk District Arbitration Court upheld a petition by two Russian regulators against the TNK-BP subsidiary.   "The decision is unfortunate, but we intend to appeal," a TNK-BP spokesman said, although he couldn't give a likely date.    A BP spokesman added: "We regret current pressure to withdraw the license."    Rusia Petroleum had filed the original suit to challenge a state inspection that uncovered violations of the license agreement at Kovykta.   While TNK-BP officials freely admit that Rusia Petroleum produced only a fraction of the 9 billion cubic meters of gas it was obliged to produce last year according to its license, they have cited a lack of local demand for gas and limited access to export markets.    The company has been prevented from selling the gas to China and South Korea by Russian gas monopoly OAO Gazprom (GSPBEX.RS). By law, Gazprom is the only company in Russia allowed to export gas.   Russia has recently been turning up the heat on foreign energy companies as part of what many observers say are state efforts to strengthen government control over the sector.    Royal Dutch Shell PLC (RDSB.LN) recently ceded control of the giant Sakhalin-II oil and gas venture to Gazprom. The move came after Mitvol hit the venture with a threat to pull a key environmental license.   Company Web site: http://www.tnk-bp.ru   -By Benoit Faucon and Andrew Langley, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 207 842 9266; benoit.faucon@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 13:16 ET (17:16 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Carlsberg Plans CNY500M China Brewery With Lanzhou Huanghe
Story: SHANGHAI (Dow Jones)--Danish brewer Carlsberg A/S (CARL-A.KO) plans to build a CNY500 million (US$65 million) brewery in China with Lanzhou Huanghe Enterprise Co. (000929.SZ), an official at the Chinese beer maker said Monday.   Carlsberg and Lanzhou Huanghe Enterprise will each invest CNY200 million in the plant, said the official, who declined to be named. A joint venture by the two companies, HuangHe JiaNiang Beer Corp., will also invest CNY100 million in the plant, the official added.   The brewery is expected to have a capacity of 500,000 metric tons, said the official. The plan is still subject to approval by Chinese regulators.   The official said Carlsberg had also talked to Lanzhou Huanghe Enterprise's largest shareholder, Lanzhou Huanghe Xinsheng Investment Co., about raising its stakes in its ventures with Lanzhou Huanghe Enterprise and deepening cooperation in production and business operations.   Carlsberg has invested a total of CNY150 million in its four brewery joint ventures with Shenzhen-listed Lanzhou Huanghe Enterprise, holding a 30% stake in each of them, said the official at the Chinese beer maker.   Officials at Carlsberg weren't immediately available for comment, and officials at Lanzhou Huanghe Xinsheng couldn't be reached Monday.   Carlsberg Chief Executive Nils Andersen said in November the company plans to invest between DKK3 billion and DKK5 billion over the 2007-2009 period to expand its capacity in Asia, and the majority of the investments will go to western China.   Analysts have said beer consumption in western China has been growing rapidly in recent years, at an annual rate of about 15%.     -Sun Yan contributed to this story; Dow Jones Newswires; 8621 6120-1200; yan.sun@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 00:35 ET (04:35 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: MUFG To Bolster Investment Banking Ops Via Personnel Shift-Nikkei
Story: NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc. (8306.TO) plans to strengthen the group's investment banking operations by beefing up cooperation between its core banking and brokerage units, The Nikkei Tuesday morning edition reported.   Starting next month, MUFG will dispatch about 200 wholesale business specialists from Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ to Mitsubishi UFJ Securities Co. (8615.TO) over a few years.   The brokerage unit's corporate customer base, which consists primarily of listed companies, is much smaller than the banking unit's. And in many cases, Mitsubishi UFJ Securities has found itself losing securities business customers to such rivals as Nomura Securities Co.   The bank employees sent to Mitsubishi UFJ Securities will engage in wholesale operations there as well. In principle, advisory services for mergers and acquisitions, business rebuilding, and capital strategy will be consolidated into the brokerage unit, which will then offer investment banking services to Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ's wholesale clients.   As part of this arrangement, MUFG will set up in June a corporate investment banking division to plan and oversee the group's investment banking strategies. While keeping in mind regulations requiring separation of banking and securities operations, MUFG will promote a cooperative marketing structure between Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ and Mitsubishi UFJ Securities.   The banking unit will also set up a division charged with promoting corporate investment banking operations. In addition, it will set up a separate division to handle management buyout and leveraged-buyout deals. This aims to expand the bank's operations beyond lending and improve overall profitability.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 12:47 ET (16:47 GMT)

Headline: Alfa Demands Turkcell Stake In Lieu Of Debt From Cukurova
Story: By Will Bland and Andrew Langley     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     MOSCOW (Dow Jones)--Russian conglomerate Alfa Group on Monday said it had demanded that Turkey's Cukurova Group forfeit its 13.8% share in mobile operator Turkcell (TKC) in lieu of a $1.35 billion debt.   Alfa telecom arm Altimo bought 13.2% of Turkcell from Cukurova in November 2005, simultaneously lending the Turkish group $1.71 billion secured against a further 13.8% stake in the operator.   Cukurova repaid $357 million at the end of last year, but has since violated the terms of the pair's loan agreement, according to Alfa, which has now asked a court in the British Virgin Islands to seize the 13.8% Turkcell stake.   "We asked for immediate repayment of the loan but didn't get the money (within the allotted timeframe), so we've asked for the shares instead," Altimo spokesman Kirill Babayev said.   Babayev said earlier in May that the company would prefer repayment from Cukurova in cash rather than shares. Cukurova subsequently took out a $1.4 billion loan, but Babayev said it was too late.   "We decided that since we had begun the process of appropriating the shares, we wouldn't stop it," he said, adding that a ruling could be expected toward the end of June.   He confirmed that should Altimo receive the stake, it would be forced to make a buyout offer to the rest Turkcell's shareholders, which include Nordic telecom group TeliaSonera (TLSN.SK).   Some analysts said this could benefit the Russian company.   "A larger stake (in Turkcell) would give Altimo greater leverage in asset-swap talks with TeliaSonera, with which Altimo is involved in a separate dispute over (Russian mobile firm OAO) MegaFon," MDM Bank analyst Elena Bazhenova said in a research note.   An extra 13.8% in Turkcell would give TeliaSonera control over the Turkish operator, something it had been hoping to do before Alfa topped its offer for Cukurova's stake back in 2005.   TeliaSonera owns almost 44% of MegaFon, Russia's third-largest mobile operator by users. Altimo has a blocking stake in that same company, although its ownership of the shares is subject to an ongoing legal challenge by Bermuda-registered fund IPOC.   In recent months, Altimo - which also owns more than 40% of Russia's No. 2 cellular provider, OAO Vimpel Communications (VIP) - has been seeking a tie-up with an international telecom group, although negotiations have so far failed to yield results.   Company Web sites: http://www.turkcell.com.tr   http://www.cukurova.com.tr   http://www.altimo.org   -By Will Bland and Andrew Langley, Dow Jones Newswires; +7 495 974 80 55; william.bland@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 08:29 ET (12:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Brazil May Take Bids On Rio-To-Sao Paulo High-Speed Rail Link
Story: RIO DE JANEIRO (Dow Jones)--Brazil's government may hold a tender in August for the construction of a $9 billion high-speed rail link between Sao Paulo and Rio de Janeiro, the transport ministry said Monday.   If current planning schedules are kept, construction of the 403-kilometer link could start early next year.   Dilma Rousseff, chief of staff to Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, will meet representatives of the European International Bank during a trip to Italy this week. The EIB is interested in financing part of the project, the transport ministry said.   "This construction could mark the administration of President Lula," Jose Francisco da Neves, president of state transport company Valec, said in a release.   Brazil's federal auditing court already has approved viability studies for the high-speed rail link, and environmental impact studies are currently being checked by Brazil's environmental protection agency Ibama, the release said.   Yet, as part of the line would cross remains of the fragile Atlantic Rain Forest, environmental studies need a "delicate analysis," the Valor newspaper said Monday.   Also, because it would run through 134 kilometers of tunnels and cross 105 bridges, the engineering project would be complex.   Brazilian, South Korean, Italian and French companies have already shown interest in building the rail link, the transport ministry said.   French train maker Alstom (1022047.FR) made a preliminary proposal to build the link, according to a report by the Estado newswire in early April.   The high-speed link would be built entirely with private money within seven years.   Ideas for high-speed links between Rio and Sao Paulo have been discussed for more than a decade, but never reached an advanced planning stage.   With a travel time of one and a half hours between the city centers of Brazil's two largest cities, the high-speed train would compete head-to-head with airlines. Currently, air shuttles take off every five to 10 minutes between the two cities at peak hours.   The greater metropolitan areas of the two cities have a combined population of almost 30 million people.     -By Bernd Radowitz, Dow Jones Newswires; +5521-3288-5004; bernd.radowitz@dowjones.com;     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 09:37 ET (13:37 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Hitachi Pres: HDD Unit To Post Oper Profit This FY
Story: (Adds details of company earnings, and its joint venture with GE.)     TOKYO (Dow Jones)--Hitachi Ltd. (6501.TO) President Kazuo Furukawa said Monday that the company's loss-making hard-disk drive unit will return to an operating profit this year, adding that additional restructuring steps are needed to accomplish that goal.   Furukawa also said that the flat-panel television unit of the electronic and industrial giant is expected to post an operating profit in the current business year.   Japan's biggest industrial and electronics conglomerate by sales expects an improvement in these flagging businesses and other restructuring steps to help the overall company return to profitability in the business year through March 2008.   "The HDD business will absolutely go into the black in fiscal 2007," he told analysts and journalists at a presentation on the company's midterm strategy.   Still, he said that second-quarter business conditions in the hard-disk drive unit are "very severe" and that more cost-cutting steps are needed.   These actions would come on top of consolidating production and slashing material and indirect personnel costs, he said. Furukawa didn't clarify what the new steps would be.   Price competition pushed the hard-disk unit further into the red in the past fiscal year, with the operating loss ballooning to Y43.7 billion from Y27.0 billion a year earlier.   The corporation, which makes everything from nuclear power plants to washing machines, posted a Y32.80 billion group net loss on Y10.248 trillion in sales last fiscal year. The company was hit by worsening margins in the hard disk and TV units and costly repairs to faulty turbine blades at nuclear power plants.   Nonetheless, Hitachi expects the company's new nuclear power joint venture with General Electric Co. (GE) to post several hundred billion yen in sales by 2015, Furukawa said.   Hitachi will hold an 80.01% stake in the joint venture Hitachi-GE Nuclear Energy Ltd., which they plan to set up on July 1. GE will take the rest.   Furukawa also reiterated his pledge to bring the company's group operating margin to 5% of its sales by the fiscal year ending in March 2010, saying he expected the current year's to be between 2.8% and 2.9%. It was 1.8% and 2.7% in fiscal 2005.     -By James Simms, Dow Jones Newswires; 813-5255-2929; james.simms@dowjones.com   -Edited by Graham Norris     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 06:21 ET (10:21 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Malaysia Ranhill To Build Oil Pipeline Worth $7B
Story: (Adds details of pipeline and refineries, and the project leader saying the pipeline is economically viable.)     KUALA LUMPUR (AP)--Malaysia's Ranhill Bhd. (5030.KU) Monday signed a contract to design and construct a $7 billion pipeline to be laid across northern Malaysia that will divert up to a third of oil now being carried through the Malacca Strait.   The signing, with project owner Trans-Peninsula Petroleum Sdn. Bhd. and  Indonesia's PT Tripatra, was witnessed by Prime Minister Abdullah Ahmad Badawi and visiting Indonesian President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono.   Under the plan, crude oil shipped from the Mideast would be refined in Kedah on the northwestern coast and pumped through the 300-kilometer pipe to Kelantan on the eastern coast. It would then be loaded onto tankers bound for Japan, China and South Korea, completely bypassing Singapore and the Malacca Strait.   Work on the pipeline will begin next year and finish in 2014, said Rahim Kamil Sulaiman, chairman of Trans-Peninsula Petroleum.   "This is not a political project. It is a commercial undertaking. The project is economically viable," he told a news conference.   Rahim said the pipeline will be a substitute for the Straits of Malacca, through which half the world's oil is shipped.   The strait is also notorious for robberies and hijackings, although the number of attacks has fallen since Malaysia, Indonesia and Singapore, which share the waterway, increased patrols in 2005.   Around 30% of vessels that transit the strait are oil tankers, he said, adding that the company aims to divert 30% of the traffic once the pipeline is completed.   Rahim said the timing of the pipeline is perfect as the oil market is shifting to East Asia, with China now being the world's second-largest oil consumer.   Trans-Penisula has also tied up with Saudi Arabia's Al-Banader International Group for oil supplies but has given no details.   Funds for the construction of the pipeline will come from local and foreign investors, Rahim said, but declined to reveal details.   Kedah Chief Minister Mahdzir Khalid told reporters that two refineries, costing a total of $9 billion, will be built in Kedah by 2010 with a combined refining capacity of 450,000 barrels a day.   Malaysian companies SKS Ventures and Merapoh Resources Corp. are expected to unveil details of the refineries in August, he said.   In a statement, Trans-Peninsula said the project will create reserve oil facilities for Asia, which accounts for about a third of world oil consumption.   It said offshore mooring facilities will be built in Yan in Kedah and Bachok in Kelantan to accommodate very large crude carriers, while a major storage tank will be built in Jeli in Kelantan.   In the first phase to be operational by mid-2011, it said the pipeline can carry 2 million barrels of oil a day with a 60 million barrels of storage capacity. This will triple to 6 million barrels a day of throughput and 180 million barrels storage when fully completed in 2014, it added.   "There will be a faster turn around of oil tankers. Congestion in the Straits of Malacca will be eased. There will be ample strategic reserve of crude oil reachable within seven days to East Asia," it said.   It currently takes oil tankers up to three weeks to sail through the strait to reach east Asia.   Rahim said construction will abide by environmental guidelines and will be designed to traverse through the least settled areas to minimize social impact.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 05:00 ET (09:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Pinetree Capital Ltd. Acquires Securities Of Happy Creek Minerals Ltd.>PNP.T
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - Pinetree Capital Ltd. (TSX:PNP), a Canadian investment company, announces that on May 25, 2007, it acquired ownership of 2,500,000 common shares ("Common Shares") of Happy Creek Minerals Ltd. ("Happy Creek") and 1,250,000 common share purchase warrants (the "Warrants"). Each Warrant entitles the holder thereof to acquire one additional common share until May 15, 2009, at a price of $0.70. In the event that the Warrants are fully exercised, these holdings represent approximately 14.9% of the total issued and outstanding common shares of Happy Creek as of May 25, 2007, calculated on a partially diluted basis assuming the exercise of the Warrants only. As a result of this transaction, Pinetree and its joint actors held, as at May 25, 2007, an aggregate of 2,560,000 common shares of Happy Creek and rights to acquire an aggregate of 1,850,000 common shares of Happy Creek upon exercise of convertible securities, including the Warrants (collectively, the "Convertible Securities"). Of these totals, Pinetree holds 2,560,000 common shares and the Warrants directly, which represents approximately 14.9% of such shares outstanding as of May 25, 2007, calculated on a partially diluted basis assuming the exercise of the Warrants only. If Pinetree and its joint actors were to exercise all of the Convertible Securities, their combined ownership would represent a total of 4,410,000 common shares of Happy Creek, or approximately 16.9% of such shares outstanding as of May 25, 2007, calculated on a partially diluted basis assuming the exercise of the Convertible Securities only.    These transactions were made for investment purposes and Pinetree and each of its joint actors could increase or decrease their respective investments in Happy Creek depending on market conditions or any other relevant factor.    About Pinetree    Pinetree Capital Ltd. ("Pinetree" or the "Company") was incorporated under the laws of the Province of Ontario and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange ("TSX") under the symbol "PNP" and is included in the Standard & Poor's/Toronto Stock Exchange composite index. Pinetree is a diversified investment and merchant banking firm focused on the small cap market. Pinetree's investments are primarily in the resources sector: Uranium, Oil & Gas, Molybdenum, Precious Metals and Base Metals. Pinetree's investment approach is to build a macro position in a sector, find the micro-cap opportunities in that sector and work with those companies to build them to commercial production and create an exit.    For more details about Pinetree and its investments, please visit our website at www.pinetreecapital.com. Headline: : AirIQ To Buy Back Up To 8M Common Shrs >IQ.T
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - May 28, 2007) - AirIQ Inc. (TSX:IQ), a leader in Wireless Location Services, specializing in Telematics and Security, today announced that the Toronto Stock Exchange (the "TSX") has accepted its filing of a Notice of Intention to Make a Normal Course Issuer Bid (the "Bid"). Pursuant to the Bid, the Company proposes to purchase through the facilities of the TSX, as appropriate opportunities arise from time to time over the next 12 months, up to an aggregate of 8 million common shares, being approximately 5% of its 160,860,908 issued and outstanding common shares, as of May 25, 2007.    Purchases may commence through the TSX on May 30, 2007 and will conclude on the earlier of the date on which purchases under the Bid have been completed and May 29, 2008. AirIQ will not repurchase more than 2% of the issued and outstanding common shares in any 30-day period. The consideration to be paid by AirIQ for any common shares it will repurchase under the Bid will be at the market price of such common shares at the time of acquisition. All common shares purchased by the Company will be cancelled. There have been no previous purchases of its common shares by the Company.    Although AirIQ clearly believes that its funds and cash reserves may be used strategically and profitably within the framework of its organic growth strategy, it has nevertheless determined that, in certain circumstances, the repurchase of its own shares by AirIQ may be an appropriate investment of funds on hand and in the best interests of the Company.    About AirIQ    AirIQ trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol IQ. A leader in Wireless Location Services, specializing in Telematics and Security, AirIQ is headquartered in Pickering, near Toronto, Canada, with an office in San Diego, California, U.S.A. The Company operates as a wireless Internet applications service provider specializing in location-based services. AirIQ's services are offered to three primary markets: Commercial Fleets; Consumer; and Marine Fleets. AirIQ gives vehicle and vessel owners the abilities to manage and protect their mobile assets. AirIQ's services include: vehicle locating, boundary notification, automated inventory, maintenance reminders, security alerts, vehicle disabling, unauthorized movement alerts and many more features. For additional information on AirIQ or its products and services, please visit the Company's website at www.airiq.com.    Forward-looking Statements    This news release contains forward-looking information based on management's best estimates and the current operating environment. These forward-looking statements are related to, but not limited to, AirIQ's operations, anticipated financial performance, business prospects and strategies. Forward-looking information typically contains words such as "anticipate", "believe", "expect", "plan" or similar words suggesting future outcomes. Such forward-looking statements are as of the date which such statement is made and are subject to a number of known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors which could cause actual results or events to differ materially from future results expressed, anticipated or implied by such forward-looking statements. Such factors include, but are not limited to, changes in market and competition, technological and competitive developments and potential downturns in economic conditions generally. Therefore, actual outcomes and results may differ materially from those expressed in such forward-looking statements. Other than as may be required by law, AirIQ disclaims any intention or obligation to update or revise any such forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. Headline: Sarkozy In No Rush To Sell Off French Industrial Jewels
Story: PARIS (AP)--French President Nicolas Sarkozy is keeping his country's business elite waiting.   The energetic Sarkozy made a big show of his determination to return Airbus, Europe's struggling planemaker, to its former glory, but other, less glamorous industrial dossiers are piling up on his desk. They are unlikely to be opened until after next month's legislative elections.   How he handles them will be a litmus test of Sarkozy's proclaimed pro-market tendencies in a country suspicious of capitalism and with deep traditions of state involvement in the economy. The most prickly plans include privatizations of major French companies that could help finance Sarkozy's tax cuts and other reforms - and would almost certainly incite mass protests and strikes.   Since Sarkozy needs to stay popular to win a parliamentary majority, he is putting off the sensitive questions until after the June 10 and 17 parliamentary elections, said Aurore Wanlin, a researcher at the Centre for European Reform: "After that, we will see. In his vision for France, the state has an important role to play in the economy."   Sarkozy's new staff is largely mum about the biggest dossiers: a long-stalled merger between national gas company Gaz de France and utility giant Suez, and the selloffs of state stakes in Electricite de France, nuclear engineering giant Areva and airport operator Aeroports de Paris, known as ADP.   Newly appointed officials at the presidential Elysee Palace and the Finance Ministry did not return calls seeking comment on Sarkozy's industrial plans.   Investors and big businesses, meanwhile, are eager to uncover Sarkozy's plans for the state's $228.5 billion in assets of traded companies.   The weekly financial newspaper Le Revenu last week published an investor guide to the government's portfolio, which ranges from a 31% stake in Safran, a conglomerate that makes jet engines, to a 19% holding in Air France-KLM. The newspaper speculated on possible share sales for 10 companies, but recommended buying only one: ADP.   French construction company Vinci has declared an interest in an eventual privatization of the airport operator, the newspaper said, explaining the stock's upside potential.   French power giant EDF is "ready" to put more shares on the market if the government decides to do so, Chairman Pierre Gadonneix said at the company's annual shareholders' meeting in Paris last week. Under French law, the state could sell an additional 17% of the company, lowering its stake to 70%.   Areva President Anne Lauvergeon, who has a long-standing relationship with Sarkozy - she was an economic adviser to President Francois Mitterrand when Sarkozy was budget minister - may be hoping to realize her ambition of an exchange listing for Areva shares. In 2005, Areva's initial public offering plan was blocked by then-Finance Minister Thierry Breton amid opposition to relinquishing control of such a strategic industry.   Another possibility for Areva is forging closer ties with Alstom, famed for its high-speed trains. At a news conference this month, Alstom Chairman and Chief Executive Patrick Kron said he sees "an interest" in forging closer ties with France's state-owned nuclear engineering firm, while stressing the government hadn't yet gotten around to studying the dossier.   Sarkozy is thought to favor a partial privatization of Areva. Martin Bouygues, CEO of Bouygues, which owns a 25.3% stake in Alstom, has long said his company would be interested in buying a stake in Areva. Another option mulled by the Journal du Dimanche this month is the sale of an Areva stake to French oil giant Total.   As for Aeroports de Paris, Sarkozy's election increases "chances for a full privatization in the future" though a "full exit" is not imminent, Franco-Belgian banking group Dexia said in a research note earlier this month.   The planned Suez-Gaz de France marriage - arranged by Sarkozy's one-time rival former Prime Minister Dominique de Villepin to fend off a bid for Suez by Italy's Enel SpA - is on hold. Villepin's successor, Francois Fillon, said Wednesday the government is considering other possibilities and will review the deal in late June or early July.   For a merger to take place, the government would have to privatize GDF, something Sarkozy promised not to do when he was finance minister in 2004. Villepin introduced legislation allowing the government to reduce its stake to 33%, a move vigorously opposed by unions and Socialist lawmakers.   Both companies say their union is the best option, but insist they will be all right if it doesn't happen. Suez announced this month it has amassed an 11% stake in Spain's Gas Natural, which analysts said could make a good alternative if the GDF deal falls through.   Sarkozy has made clear the priority of his "ambitious industrial policy" is Airbus, and has vowed to seek new investors or inject new cash in the European planemaker. It became a major French campaign issue after massive layoffs combined with an enormous golden handshake for the ousted chief executive sparked a public outcry.   Airbus was on the menu of Sarkozy's first overseas visit, to see German Chancellor Angela Merkel. He picked an Airbus factory near Toulouse for his first domestic visit to talk with unions and management.   Airbus has suffered from a falling U.S. dollar - the currency in which it sells planes - and two years of delays to the 555-seater A380, which have wiped more than $6.6 billion off Airbus' profit forecasts for 2006-2010.   The French government currently owns 15% of EADS, while Paris-based Lagardere SCA owns 7.5%. Their combined stake is balanced by Stuttgart, Germany-based DaimlerChrysler AG, which holds 22.5% of voting rights in the defense group.   Sarkozy has cited his experience with Alstom as a possible model: As finance minister, Sarkozy engineered a euro2.5 billion, state-orchestrated bailout to steer the train and power-plant builder away from bankruptcy.   "Alstom was much simpler," said Pierre Boucheny, an analyst at Kepler Equities in Paris. "With EADS, Daimler and the Germans have always said that the state doesn't have a role in managing companies."   Der Spiegel reported last week that Merkel was cool about Sarkozy's plans to raise the state's stake in EADS.   "The German government's position on EADS is to pursue a private investors' solution and to reduce public stakes in the company," government spokesman Thomas Steg told reporters in Berlin.   Analysts said Sarkozy's handling of the dossier will speak volumes about his diplomatic skills and free-market tendencies.   "He's first and foremost pragmatic," said Boucheny. "He's someone who believes in the market but who also believes the state has a role to play."     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 12:23 ET (16:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Mitsui OSK To Build Fuel Carrier With Omani Partner -Nikkei
Story: TOKYO (Nikkei)--Mitsui O.S.K. Lines Ltd. (9104.TO) and Oman's state-operated maritime shipper agreed to jointly own a ship for transporting gasoline and other petroleum products, The Nikkei Tuesday morning edition reported.   The agreement marks the second time that Mitsui O.S.K and Oman Shipping Co. will own together a vessel for hauling petroleum products produced in the Middle Eastern country.   The planned carrier will be built by Sasebo Heavy Industries Co. (7007.TO) for a cost of about Y8 billion and come into operation as early as 2009.   Mitsui O.S.K. and Oman Shipping, a state-owned firm, will form a 50-50 joint venture to build a large tanker with capacity of 110,000 tons. The carrier will be operated by the Japanese firm and ship primarily gasoline as well as diesel fuel and jet fuel to such markets as China, Europe and the U.S.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 13:33 ET (17:33 GMT)

Headline: EUROPEAN MORNING BRIEFING: Shares Likely Quiet On Holiday -2
Story: BONDS:   Prices of European government bonds Monday may start mixed, while investors wait for key inflation figures this week to either solidify or weaken expectations for more rates hikes.   Germany's preliminary consumer price index, due Tuesday, is forecast to be unchanged on the year in May and slightly down on month from April.   Some economists, however, believe there is a risk that inflation could rise on the back of higher energy prices.   "High oil prices will continue to filter through to the CPI in May and as the base effects are unfavorable this month, energy-driven year-on-year inflation rates will rise," said BNP Paribas economists in a research note to clients.   Transport prices fell in the equivalent month in 2006.   A Dow Jones Newswires survey of economists forecasts the German preliminary CPI to rise 0.2% on month and by 1.9% on year.   Euro zone flash inflation for May is due Thursday with similar expectations.   "Inflation probably remained unchanged at 1.9% year-on-year for the third consecutive month in May," said Citigroup economists.   A Dow Jones Newswires survey of economists also expects a 1.9% on-year result.   In the U.K., the manufacturing Purchasing Manager Index for May, due Friday, will be closely watched for signs that manufacturers' pricing power is picking up.   U.K. economist for HSBC, Karen Ward, said: "Given the current inflation concerns, the pricing component of this survey is probably the most important at this juncture. The CBI survey showed pricing expectations reached their highest level in over 10 years, so this component of the (PMI) survey may also remain elevated," Ward said.   On the U.S. Treasurys market, traders will watch for the payrolls report due Friday.   Treasury yields hit multi-month highs late last week. While an especially strong jobs report could spark yields to reach fresh highs, another surprisingly low figure could encourage investors to again grow hopeful of an impending cut in interest rates, helping Treasurys to stage a recovery after their month-long decline.   "If unemployment is a strong number, I think we definitely break through the high-end in yield," said Mary Ann Hurley, vice president of fixed income trading at D.A. Davidson, with the 10-year rate possibly pushing to 5%. That key psychological mark hasn't been hit since August of last year.   Analysts at Barclays Capital in New York are expecting 140,000 new jobs to be created in May, with market expectations for the data ranging from 44,000 to 180,000 new jobs.   If the report were to come in at 140,000, that could be "a bit of relief" for Treasurys, said Dominic Konstam, head of interest rate strategy at Credit Suisse, as many investors are fearing a stronger number.   Even if a much stronger figure were to take a toll on Treasurys, pushing prices lower and yields higher, Konstam said that he doesn't expect the market to be too damaged by the report.   John Canavan, market analyst at Stone and McCarthy in New York, pointed to renewed investor concerns about dwindling interest in U.S. Treasurys overseas as another factor that has and that could continue to put pressure on the bond market.   If data this week manage to once again take the 10-year note through a 4.90% yield, "it's probably a pretty quick shot back to 5%," Canavan said.   He said 5% is the next key level for the note and a yield that may well entice overseas buyers to jump back in.   In Japan, prices of government bonds recovered Monday from earlier losses on buying on dips and on technical factors, with Japan's banks and insurers said to be pacing the rebound.   Bank of Japan Governor Toshihiko Fukui said that there isn't a set timetable for when the central bank will next raise interest rates, Asahi Shimbun reports.   ENERGY:   Oil prices edged lower in Asian trading Monday after a Nigerian oil workers' unions strike that threatened to reverse the sale of government refineries ended over the weekend. July Nymex dropped 38 cents to $64.82, after gaining more than a $1 on Friday.   However, the market expects U.S. summer holiday driving to keep up gasoline demand and support the broader market.   METALS:   Spot gold is trading flat at $655.40, after its $2.40 rise on Friday. The market is drawing no clues from narrow currency movements, and gold's technicals point sideways and a lack of momentum. For now, gold is seen in a trading band of around $655-658. Copper futures were little changed.     CALENDAR:    Monday, May 28, 2007  GMT                                                      Expected  Previous  0900  ITA          6-month T-Bill Auction  0900  ITA          29-day T-Bill Auction  0900  ITA          24-month Zero-Coupon Bonds Auction  1330  EU           ECB call for main refi tender  2330  JPN  Apr     Labor Force Survey                       4.0%      4.0%  2330  JPN  Apr     Household Spending                       +0.1%YY   +0.1%YY  2350  JPN  Apr     Retail Sales, prelim                               -0.7%YY  N/A   UK   May     House Prices Survey                                +0.7%MM                                                                        +6.8%YY  N/A   GER          ASEM foreign mins meeting  N/A   US           Memorial Day holiday; all banks,                     markets and businesses closed  N/A   ITA          Italy municipal elections, day 2 of                     voting     -By Dennis Baker; Dow Jones Newswires; dennis.baker@dowjones.com     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 01:00 ET (05:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
