Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Toll Holders Vote To Spin Off Rail, Ports Assets
Story: (Adds final vote, stock price.)     By Andrew Harrison   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     MELBOURNE (Dow Jones)--Toll Holdings Ltd. (TOL.AU) shareholders Monday agreed to spin off the rail and ports assets of Australia's largest transport company into a separate company - Asciano Ltd.   Under the plan, the company's investors will keep their existing shares and receive a stapled security made up of one new share and one new unit in Asciano for each share they own in Toll.   Toll Chief Executive Paul Little said the arrangement would give the Melbourne-based company access to key infrastructure without the need to own it, thereby satisfying competition regulations, and allowing it to raise as much as an additional A$1 billion in debt for acquisitions.   "This gives us a lot of capacity on our balance sheet," Little told reporters after the meeting.   "This restructure will allow both the Asciano business and our business to grow more aggressively," he said.   Shares in Toll Monday closed down 1.5% at A$22.03, compared with the broader market ending little changed.   Toll investors passed the spinoff plan, with 368.2 million shares in favor and 376,996 against.   If court approval is gained, Asciano shares will start trading on June 6.   Toll acquired the ports business, a 62% stake in Virgin Blue Holdings Ltd. (VBA.AU), Australia's second-largest airline, and full control of the Pacific National rail business, in which Toll previously had a half stake, from its A$6 billion acquisition of Patrick Corp. last year.   Toll had to spin off Asciano because the need to invest capital in the rail and ports assets restricted the company's acquisition plans and raised antitrust concerns, Little said.   "Toll previously had achieved a 20% pretax return on capital," he said.   "To be going down to a sub-10% return was something we felt our shareholders weren't overly excited about, and we needed to address that problem and this was the best outcome," Little said.     Leadership Position Maintained     He told the meeting that after the spinoff Toll would remain one of Asia's leading providers of integrated logistics services.   "With Asian logistics markets expected to grow at rates of up to 25% per year, expansion of Toll Asia is a key platform for the development of the Toll business," Little said.   Toll still had an appetite for acquisitions, he told reporters after the meeting.   "There are a number of smaller acquisitions that we believe we can move forward with very quickly and I think the larger ones are certainly available too," Little said.   The company was seeking acquisitions in Australia, New Zealand and Asia, and later this week will announce an equity stake in Hong Kong-based Cargo Services Far East Ltd., Little said.   The acquisition of the stake in the privately held freight forwarding company will help Toll expand its logistics business in and out of China, he said.   He declined to say how large the equity stake in Cargo Services was.   Toll will also announce in a few weeks a joint venture with Virgin Blue, in which the company will have exclusive use of "belly space" in Virgin's aircraft to help Toll expand its international logistics business, Little said.   "And over and above that, Toll has recently commissioned three of its own purpose-designed 737 air freighters and we are now running them around Australia," he said.   "The specialized Toll freighters plus the Virgin Blue 'belly space' collectively will give us a wonderful platform for our air freight business," Little said.   Asciano is seeking to acquire bulk rail assets in Queensland and Western Australia states and to participate in ports expansion, Chief Executive Mark Rowsthorn told reporters after the meeting.   The company wants to gain customers in Queensland to carry coal and agricultural commodities in Western Australia, he said.   Rowsthorn is comfortable with Asciano's A$6 billion net debt, which is "comparable with our peers in infrastructure and arguably we could push the gearing harder if we chose to do that."   The company had a gearing of about 60%, which will rise to 67% in the company's first three years as it invests in expanding its Brisbane ports assets and its national rail network, he said.   Asciano also has joined a consortium that is bidding to build and operate a 2,600-kilometer railroad in Saudi Arabia to carry freight, he said.     -By Andrew Harrison, Dow Jones Newswires; 61-3-9671-4323; andrew.harrison@dowjones.com   -Edited by Marissa Chew     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 04:24 ET (08:24 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Toronto Stks Higher At Midday, Led By Base Metals -2-
Story: New York markets were closed, which made for thin trading in Canada.   Overall, nine of Toronto's 10 sector indexes were higher.   The strongest sector was materials, which was up 0.97%. In the group, aluminum producer Alcan had risen C$1.11 to C$92.76 as merger speculation around the company intensified. In addition, senior miner Teck Cominco was up 0.98 to 44.14 and fertilizer company Potash had gained 1.36 to 73.40.   The heavily-weighted financials sector was up a respectable 0.23%, with Royal Bank Of Canada up 0.17 to 59.00 and Toronto Dominion gaining 0.08 at 72.40. Two more of the big Canadian banks are set to report earnings this week.   Telecommunications giant BCE was up 0.04 at 39.45 and the telecom services sector rose 0.42%.   Blackberry-maker Research In Motion had fallen 2.20 to 177.15, but software company Cognos had added 0.52 to 43.94; the information technology group had traded 0.09% higher.   On the other hand, the mighty energy sector was a drag, shedding 0.55%, making it the lone group in the red. There, EnCana was down 0.75 to 65.18 and Petro-Canada was off 0.58 to 54.11.     -Andy Georgiades, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2031;     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 11:53 ET (15:53 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Major Shareholder Of First Capital Realty Updates Value Of First Capital Realty's Properties Under International Financial Reporting Standards>FCR.T
Story: TORONTO, May 28 /CNW/ - The major shareholder of First Capital Realty Inc. ("First Capital Realty") (TSX:FCR), Gazit-Globe Inc. ("Gazit"), released its financial results for the period ended March 31, 2007, including the aggregate value of First Capital Realty's shopping centre portfolio and land and shopping centres under development applying International Financial Reporting Standards ("IFRS"). First Capital Realty today released the IFRS values related to First Capital Realty's portfolio that have been incorporated within the values that were released by Gazit.    The most significant difference between IFRS and Canadian generally accepted accounting principles ("Canadian GAAP") for this purpose is that income-producing shopping centres ("Shopping Centres") are presented at fair market value under IFRS as opposed to cost less accumulated amortization under Canadian GAAP. In addition, the values of deferred costs, straight line rents receivable and intangible assets and liabilities related to Shopping Centres are not presented separately under IFRS as their values are incorporated within the values for Shopping Centres. Land and shopping centres under development ("Development Properties") are presented at cost under both IFRS and Canadian GAAP. In addition, First Capital Realty's future income tax liability increases as a result of the change in value of the Shopping Centres under IFRS. This information is set out in the table below:          <<                                                               As at      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      $ millions                                        March 31,  December 31,                                                            2007          2006      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      IFRS value of Shopping Centres and       Development Properties                           $  3,685      $  3,413      Canadian GAAP value of Shopping Centres and       Development Properties (Note 1)                     2,859         2,705      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      Difference between IFRS value and       Canadian GAAP value                                   826           708      Increase in future income taxes as a result       of the difference in value                           (142)         (123)      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      Difference in value, net of taxes                 $    684      $    585      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      >>      Note 1 - Includes the net book value of Shopping Centres, Development    Properties, deferred costs, straight line rents receivable and intangible    assets and liabilities.    The total fair value of Shopping Centres at March 31, 2007 was determined through a retrospective analysis of market capitalization rates applicable to the Company's portfolio of Shopping Centres conducted by a nationally recognized appraisal firm who conducted the appraisals of the Company's Shopping Centres as at December 31, 2006. The aggregate weighted average stabilized capitalization rate on the Shopping Centres analyzed by the appraisal firm was 6.58% at March 31, 2007.    Of the total fair value of Shopping Centres at December 31, 2006, approximately 91% was determined through independent appraisals conducted by the appraisal firm. The Shopping Centres were appraised on an individual basis, with no portfolio effect considered. The remainder of the values of the Shopping Centres, which consisted primarily of recently completed development projects and acquisitions, were based upon the costs of these Shopping Centres to First Capital Realty. The independent appraisals were prepared so as to comply with the fair value model described in the IAS 40 - Investment Property and the International Valuation Standard.    The primary method of appraisal was an income approach, since purchasers typically focus on expected income. For each property, the appraisers conducted and placed reliance upon a) a direct capitalization method, which is the appraisers' estimate of the relationship between value and stabilized income, normally in the first year and b) a discounted cash flow method, which is the appraisers' estimate of the present value of future cash flows over a specified horizon, including the potential proceeds from a deemed disposition. The determination of these values required management and the appraisers to make estimates and assumptions that affect the values presented, and actual values in a sales transaction may differ from the values shown above. Based on these valuation methods, the aggregate weighted average stabilized capitalization rate on the Shopping Centres as at December 31, 2006 was 6.81%.    ABOUT FIRST CAPITAL REALTY (TSX:FCR)    First Capital Realty is Canada's leading owner, developer and operator of supermarket-anchored neighbourhood and community shopping centres, located predominantly in growing metropolitan areas. The Company currently owns interests in 162 properties, including 7 under development, with approximately 19.0 million square feet of gross leasable area, and also has 9 land sites in the planning stage for future retail development. In addition, the Company owns 13.9 million shares of Equity One (approximately 19%), one of the largest shopping centre REITs in the southern U.S., that trades on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol EQY. Including its investments in Equity One, the Company has interests in 338 properties totalling approximately 36.9 million square feet of gross leasable area.             /CONTACT: Dori J. Segal, President & C.E.O., or Karen H. Weaver, C.F.O., First Capital Realty Inc., 85 Hanna Ave., Suite 400, Toronto, Ontario, Canada, M6K 3S3, Tel: (416) 504-4114, Fax: (416) 941-1655, www.firstcapitalrealty.ca     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 09:04 ET (13:04 GMT)

Headline: : GOL Launches Flights to Cruzeiro do Sul, in Acre
Story: SAO PAULO, Brazil, May 28 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- GOL Linhas Aereas Inteligentes (NYSE: GOL and Bovespa: GOLL4), Brazil's low-cost, low-fare airline, today launched flights to Cruzeiro do Sul, in northwest Acre. With the addition of this new destination, GOL's daily flights from Fortaleza (CE) will reach the furthest regions of Brazil through connecting flights in Belem (PA), Manaus (AM), Porto Velho (RO) and Rio Branco (AC).     Cruzeiro do Sul is the second-largest city in Acre and is the main city of the Alto Jurua region. The city is only accessible by road during the June- August summer months via the unpaved BR-364 highway, and boats are the most common mode of transportation for people and goods. GOL's flights will contribute to the development of the region by offering travelers a safe, alternative form of transportation at affordable fares.     Acre's main agricultural exports are cassavas, corn, chestnuts and beans. The state also produces rubber and has strong lumber and furniture industries. Cruzeiro do Sul is GOL's second destination in Acre; the Company began regular flights to the capital, Rio Branco, in August 2004. The city's airport, Cruzeiro do Sul International Airport, is located 14 kilometers from the city's center and is a base for commercial jets as well as medium and large cargo aircraft.     "The launch of this new destination is a response to customer demand and will allow greater access to tourism and commercial activities in the Amazon region and neighboring countries, particularly with Peru," says Tarcisio Gargioni, Vice President of Marketing and Services at GOL. Cruzeiro do Sul is only 250 kilometers from Pucalpa, Peru by plane.     Tickets to Cruzeiro do Sul are available for purchase through GOL's website (http://www.voegol.com.br). Please see the destination table below for flight departure schedules:          Origin             Destination     Frequency       Departure       Arrival      Fortaleza        Cruzeiro do Sul     Daily          6:30 AM        1:20 PM      Belem            Cruzeiro do Sul     Daily          8:40 AM        1:20 PM      Manaus           Cruzeiro do Sul     Daily         10:00 AM        1:20 PM      Porto Velho      Cruzeiro do Sul     Daily         11:55 AM        1:20 PM      Rio Branco       Cruzeiro do Sul     Daily         12:20 PM        1:20 PM        CONTACT: GOL Linhas Aereas Inteligentes S.A. Headline: =WSJ: URS Agrees To Buy Rival Washington Group Intl For $2.6B
Story: By Vauhini Vara   Of THE WALL STREET JOURNAL     URS Corp. (URS) agreed to buy rival engineering company Washington Group International Inc. (WNG) for about $2.6 billion in cash and stock, in a deal that highlights a construction boom driven by energy-efficiency and government projects.   The deal, valued at $80 for each Washington Group share, represents a 14% premium to that company's share price of $69.97 at 4 p.m. EDT on Friday, the last trading day before the Memorial Day holiday.   The acquisition comes as power companies invest aggressively in emissions reduction and energy conservation, while federal agencies such as the U.S. Departments of Defense and Energy increasingly outsource engineering and construction projects to the private sector. It continues a streak of acquisitions for San Francisco-based URS. After helping the company rebound from near-bankruptcy 18 years ago, Chief Executive Martin Koffel has turned it through acquisitions into one of the world's largest engineering-services companies. Most recently, the company bought EG&G Technical Services Holdings LLC from buyout partnership Carlyle Group in 2002 for $335 million.   (This story and related background material will be available on The Wall Street Journal Web site, WSJ.com.)   URS's latest target, Washington Group, is an engineering and construction company in Boise, Idaho, focused on customers in government, mining and power - industries that URS is keen to reach, as they increasingly invest in infrastructure and energy-efficiency projects. The acquisition also fills in URS's need for construction capabilities, an area where it previously hadn't focused.   "This allows us to be one of the fully integrated engineering and construction firms," Koffel said in an interview.   The deal will create the fourth-largest publicly traded engineering-and-construction company in the U.S., based on 2006 revenue, the companies said. The companies' combined 2006 revenue would have been $7.6 billion. Based on previously issued guidance, the companies expect to have combined 2007 revenue of approximately $8.6 billion. The combined company would have projects in over 50 countries and have more than 54,000 employees.   URS said it expects the increased size to better position the combined companies in high-growth markets such as power, infrastructure and environmental management. Other industry heavyweights include Fluor Corp. (FLR), Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (JEC) and KBR Inc. (KBR). The combined company also will have one of the largest teams of nuclear scientists and engineers in the industry. It hopes to meet growing demand for a range of engineering and construction services on large, complex transportation and water and wastewater projects, as well be a major contractor for the U.S. government.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  May 28, 2007 17:20 ET (21:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
